Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Eve2463
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were upgraded to a Junior Suite with no extra charge. The rooms were extremely spacious and very comfortable. I was amazed at the space. The location was fantastic. I have recommended that my parents stay in this hotel next month and I will be back again! Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: kaberk
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and found the Roger Smith Hotel for a Four Star Hotel had a reasonable room rate. What is that old saying... you get what you pay for! When I checked in I was running off to a meeting so I gave my bags to the bellman to deliver to my room. When I got back aroun 9:30 at night I finally saw the room. I had a Jr. Suite and the room was a good size, minimal electric outlets and no wireless connection. They told me that would work on that on Monday (which never happened). I have an iPad, a Smart Phone and a Kindle Fire, none of which could connect to the wireless network. The first thing I noticed was that there are no fire sprinklers in the room (the hotel was grandfathered in, they told me and so does not need to comply). Also there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. There was however, an old and tired mattress. In the morning I went to the restaurant for breakfast which was okay eggs coffee and croissants. On the way out I noticed that the restaurant had received a B rating from the board of health, which means that they received a negative 14 to 27 points for sanitary violations. I did not eat there again! By the way, that rating is on a large 8x10 sign that most restaurants post proudly, theirs was conveniently hidden behind the door leading into the restaurant. If I hadn't prepaid (won't do that again) I would have moved. I certainly won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, location, value”
Reviews.Author: Fed S
Reviews.Content: As I did not know this hotel, it was not my first option for a 4 night stay in NY but I was very happy with what I found and would stay there again. The staff are extremely friendly and courteous. Rooms are clean and spacious (I had a walk-in closet - never before in NYC), although I think some on the higher floors have been ugraded\renovated. The radiator in the room was making some noise on the first night - I was immediately moved to another room and given a breakfast voucher for the incovenience. I found this pretty to be pretty impressive. The price\value point is excellent and I think tough to beat in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic and historical”
Reviews.Author: TheRealKatieWest
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith Hotel was completely surprising. Every floor and every room is different. It all looks like an ecelectic grandma was living in the building right before you checked in and she was really into art from all over the world. I mean that in a good way. I loved the charisma of this hotel that comes from the historical charm of keeping the original USPS system in the hotel and the original bath drains that you open up outside the tub! The rooms are quite spacious for NYC and the free wifi is excellent! I really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but spacious”
Reviews.Author: milo52
Reviews.Content: We had booked a one bedroom suite which was a bit tired looking but nice and spacious. Staff were very friendly, except there was no-one to help us in with bags when we arrived. Wifi was very patchy. Quiet for NY with windows on two sides. Restaurant only served breakfast but there were some delis nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sisters' Weekend at The Roger Smith”
Reviews.Author: DonaldHuber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so wonderful that I almost hate to write a favorable review and turn other NYC travelers onto it. The desk clerk was warm and helpful, the parking attendant speedy, and the two room suite we shared was perfect. The bedroom reminded me of staying in a friend's guest room, 4 poster bed, dresser with pretty lamps and tasteful curtains The bed was comfy and since we own a B&B in Vermont we know about what makes a bed comfy! We were able to walk to and from the theater, feeling safe the whole way. Breakfast was prompt and good and the waiters full of good NYC tips. The tres cute popup jewelry store attached to the hotel was a real find as well. All in all, this was a perfect hotel, in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and very good area.”
Reviews.Author: Cristal2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights at the Roger Smith Hotel and enjoyed very much. Good place, near the Central Station and the Rockfeller Center, Moma, etc. As I Like to walk I went to most of the places I wanted by foot. For those who dont like there's the metro really close. People very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Be Nice To Yourself...”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: ...and check into the Roger Smith, a hotel with charm, warmth, and an amazingly friendly and helpful front desk staff. We first stayed at "The Roger" about six years ago while on a business trip, and have been back at least twice a year since...always for pleasure. It's in a perfect location - an enjoyable walk to the Theater District, five blocks to Grand Central, and only 4 blocks to the 4-5-6 Trains, which will connect you to virtually every NYC sight. The high-ceilinged rooms harken back to the days when hotels were built like homes...and we certainly feel at home from the moment we enter the small, tranquil lobby, which is adorned with artwork - yet another hallmark of the Roger Smith. Stir in the coziness of Lily's, a small, quiet bar right off the lobby, and top it off with free Wireless internet, and you're sure to be a fan of the Roger Smith, too. However, if you prefer glitzy, moussed, Vegas-type hotels, perhaps you should look elsewhere. No worry; there are plenty of 'em around.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and gracious”
Reviews.Author: ruthiemBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my only choice for a New York stay because from when I check in to when I check out I feel welcomed and at home. It is a little old world but that is what makes it classy. I never feel like a nameless visitor being "customer serviced" as quickly as possible. The staff is efficient, accomodating and friendly in the lowest key way. The rooms are clean, art exhibits and books are everywhere belying any idea that it is copnstructed for effect and with all the languages spoken by patrons, I feel like I am in a lovely, and sophisticated setting.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly reception”
Reviews.Author: moscovite2011
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel has left inconsistent memoirs. Rooms are beautifully decorated, but in the winter in them is very cold. Heaters work badly. The hotel personnel as a whole is friendly, but some workers talk to visitors very roughly. In particular receptionist Mr Randy alan Ogoff it is very rough, unfriendly, dares to offend visitors, often pretends that doesn't hear, when to him address. The main advantage of this hotel is its location. From here it is possible to reach many sights of New York by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Ijean
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a boutique style hotel, the rooms are full of old furniture so you have the feeling to go back in the past, which is quite cozy. The room was certainly big enough, we had a twin bedded room with 2 bigs, great comfy beds! the bathroom is spaciois as well and all furniture from the past is kept as well but all worked well. The location is perfect, 5min walk to Grand Central, 10-15min walk to Times Square and a bus stop just across the street. Breakfast is easy to get as within 100m walk from the hotel, there are more 5 cafÃ©s to have breakfast and lunch. The disadvantage was the room temperature, we were there in January and we had to open the window all day to lower the temprarture, the heating was not on but there was a heating tube coming thru our room which was incredibly hot so this tube heated up the whole room. The advantage of being on Lexington Av is,that the noise is less at night, during the day it is a busy avenue, but once rush hour is over, it is quite quiet for Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Just four words: I felt at home”
Reviews.Author: Alfonso B
Reviews.Content: It is not my first time at that hotel, and I have to say that it is my house in New York. I donÂ´t know what to remark: the staff, the tratment, the location.... Everything is perfect!! Well, what makes it perfect is the personnel....FANTASTIC!!! Thank you for everything!! Alfonso Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Bugletta
Reviews.Content: I thought at the price this place would be a dump, but it was lovely! Room was clean and well-appointed, bed and pillows were amazingly comfortable, staff was warm and friendly. Location was perfect for my purposes. Good breakfast in their restaurant. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable & great location”
Reviews.Author: LegalHunt
Reviews.Content: Positive: GREAT location---walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Blg., American Girl Doll Store, etc., etc. Beds very comfortable. Rooms very clean. Staff very helpful & friendly---they go out of their way to accommodate your needs. Affordable rates. Negative: Rooms on the small side---if you have kids, definitely upgrade to jr suite; TV channels not kid-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Non-pretentious in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: RonT58
Reviews.Content: A nice, little and totally non-pretentious (don't take the 'boutique hotel' thing to seriously) hotel in mid-east Manhattan. Not many facilities (like fitness or room service, and they charge a dollar for a print-out) but all in all a good, uneventful stay. Breakfast pretty good and at a nice place, overseeing Lexington Avenue. Room not very well cleaned at all though, amongst other things I found a piece of jewelry on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but Noisy on Lex”
Reviews.Author: sapamire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area on the corner of 47th and Lexington Ave. It's close to Rock Center, a quick 15 minute walk to the theater district and an easy walk to a couple of subway stops. So here's the issue with the RS Hotel. The rooms are tidy, not dirty but not super clean. It was a little dusty, but no big deal. The area rug was stained (because it was a white carpet unlike most hotels that have dark carpets so you can't see stains). The bathroom was clean, but it had a half glass shower door because it was one of those longer showers. So a wet floor can become an issue. But since most rooms face Lex and there is also a nightclub outside of the hotel, you are going to hear noise a good portion of the night. The typical NY sirens, honking, people talking (or screaming) ... is unavoidable when you are facing any major street or avenue. But for $229 (including tax), this hotel was a great deal for a NYC property. So I'm giving this a 4 star review for location and 2 star for noise since you're facing a major street.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Rosie B
Reviews.Content: +ves - good location, friendly & helpful front desk staff, comfortable beds & adequate room size. -ves - no room service, no minibar, no kettle (a bottom of the range coffee machine provided) & only dried milk powder, decor = tatty & tired - ripped wallpaper, horrible bathroom and kitchen areas. If you pay a fair and appropriate price then this may suit you. We paid almost Â£2000 for 9 nights which was too much for nothing more than a B&B without the breakfast. We could have stayed at the Warwick for the same money. Listing says 4 stars but it isn't. It's a 3 at most.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: r0undtrip
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, room was large and very clean. Hotel ammenidites are minimal but the room itself was lovely. Our room had two very comfortable beds, a dresser, desk, two plush chairs, a TV stand that doubled as a bookshelf and one night stand. The room itself was quite large with a closet and spacious bathroom. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service And Excellent Guest Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: richard t
Reviews.Content: I had the recent occasion to be a guest at your fine hotel with the dates of my stay being Saturday, December 24th, 2011 thru Monday, December 26th, 2011, and upon my arrival on Saturday the 24th, I was promptly and politely greeted by guest services agent Randy Alan Ogoff who said he would be right with me as he was attending to the check-in needs of another hotel guest. I was then quickly assisted with my check-in by the on-duty security guard who was also polite and offered me a cordial greeting to your fine hotel. I was checked in and went to my room which I believe was #805. Upon entering my room I observed a rather small television in the room and thought for a 3 star hotel, they should have flat screen televisions by now and at this time I went down to the front desk and spoke with G.S. A. Randy Alan Ogoff. I asked him if there were any other rooms available with perhaps a larger television. I then offered him my reasons for being in New York City during the Christmas Holiday. In short, my parents and sister were killed last year in a motor vehicle accident and I had no immediate family anywhere in the New England area and that my partner of 5 years and myself were here in New York City to get away and kind of enjoy but yet forget about the holiday because it is such a tragic time for me in my life. It was around the holidays that my family was killed by an off duty truck driver who was also drunk behind the wheel of his large truck. G.S.A. Ogoff handed me a room key and told me to check out a room, I believe it was #1205 to see if there was a larger television in that room. I was saddened to find that that room also had a very small television with a vhs tape player installed as well. We are clearly in the DVD era and the hotel really needs to upgrade their televisions. I promptly returned to the front desk and upon my arrival G.S.A. Ogoff handed me an envelope and said based on my family circumstances and my request for a larger television as I would be spending a good deal of time in my room for the two days that I would be a guest in your hotel, he had upgraded me to a junior suite at no additional charge for the two day stay. I was just beyond words and quickly expressed my gratitude and thanked him kindly for being such a sweet, caring and concerned about his guests employee of the hotel. I went up to my junior suite, room # 1110 I believe and found it to be a beautiful room with a flat screen television and large enough for me and my partner to enjoy for the two day stay at the hotel. And throughout my entire stay I bumped into, said hello to and spoke with G.S.A. Randy Alan Ogoff on many occasions and always found him to be smiling, kind, caring, gentle, and willing to help me in any way possible. He went well above and beyond what one would expect from a guest services agent at any hotel, let alone The Roger Smith Hotel! He is indeed an asset to your fine hotel and I canâ€™t say enough about this man and the wonderful way I was treated as a guest during my stay at the hotel. I truly wish all guest services agents and front desk personnel at all other hotels were as nice and caring about their guests as Randy Alan Ogoff was and is for and from what I observed all of the guests that came and went at the hotel. He was always smiling and seemed truly happy to be at work during the Christmas holiday weekendâ€¦unlike many other employees that I observed in other stores and restaurants in the city during my stay. Many clearly did not like the fact they had to work during the holidaysâ€¦G.S.A. Randy Alan Ogoff was indeed the exception to the rule and I believe he is truly an asset to be appreciated as an employee of The Roger Smith Hotel. Upon getting home from my little vacation, I could not wait to sit down and compose this letter and send it off to you at the hotel to tell you about my wonderful and pleasing experience and that I will surely be staying at your hotel in the future should I be returning to the fine city of New York in the future. If you would like to reach me for any reason as it relates to this letter and my personal opinions and observations of Guest Services Agent Randy Alan Ogoff, please do not hesitate to contact me at the address, phone number or email address listed above. I would be happy to provide you with any and all information that you may request as it relates to my letter. I truly enjoyed my stay at The Roger Smith Hotel because it is s very beautiful hotel, the junior suite I stayed in was gorgeous and because G.S.A. Ogoff went well above and beyond his job description and duties to see to it that I, as a guest of the hotel, enjoyed my stay and was comfortable. Thank you in advance for your time, patience and cooperation as it relates to my letter of personal thanks and reference about the fine work ethics and skills that G.S.A. Randy Alan Ogoff possess and implements while employed at The Roger Smith Hotel. He is an asset that should never be allowed to leave! Very Truly Yours; Richard W. Thunberg Jr.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this place”
Reviews.Author: 8dybug99
Reviews.Content: I am not one of those people that requires things to be brand-new. In fact, I was drawn to this hotel because it was funky and artsy. But, I am a person that requires good service -- and unfortunately, the Roger Smith didn't provide that during this trip. I had really high hopes because there were so many reviews commending the excellent service and friendly staff. We arrived early and I knew we could not check in, but we went to the hotel anyway in order to drop off our luggage. I told the man at the front desk that we were early and he snidely replied "Quite". It really took me back. I explained that we were not asking to check in, just to drop off our luggage. He just sort of waved me to the bellhop and turned his back on me (although there was nobody else requiring assistance at that time). When we came back later that evening, the check in went smoothly. Our room was comfortable and clean. The water pressure in our room was terrible though and the hair dryer did not work. We also could not figure out how to turn on the heater, so when we left the next morning, we mentioned it. When we arrived back that evening, they had turned the radiator on, and it was easily 90 degrees in our room. We had to turn on the AC to cool it down. We went to the bar one night and were the only ones there. The bartender seemed annoyed that we had come in and made sure we knew that he was closing in 30 minutes. We just ordered our drinks and took them back upstairs. On the plus side, the location can't be beat for the price. The rooms were a good size by NYC standards and we had a high floor room, so we did not have much street noise. The beds were comfortable. They do not have room service but you can order from a handful of restaurants that they have an arrangement with -- they just add it to your final hotel bill. We ordered Chinese food and it was delivered at lightnening speed. However, we paid a delivery fee and an automatic gratuity on top of the gratuity we gave when the food was delivered to our door. We would have been better off ordering take out and getting it ourselves. This hotel does a great job with it's social media messaging, The social media vibe has a totally different feel than the actual vibe when you walk in the door, so I think that is a problem. And, maybe the attitude had a lot to do with the fact that it was Christmas-time and very busy, but when you are in the hospitality industry, I don't think you can use that as an excuse. I'm sorry to say that we won't return. I had high hopes that this would be our new NYC favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, lovely service, great location”
Reviews.Author: 3bythesea
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I went to NYC for Christmas and couldn't have been happier with our hotel. Great rate and location. The room was lovely and clean bright.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value!”
Reviews.Author: davealoha
Reviews.Content: Yes the room decor and furniture is dated but the bathrooms have been renovated, the room is spacious, the bed is comfortable, and you are a few blocks away from Times Sq. and Broadway. For the price it's hard to beat the location and value you will have by staying at the Roger Smith Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New York, best city in the world?”
Reviews.Author: maria_elander
Reviews.Content: Yes, I think one of them at least! Second time at Roger Smith and this time with my family and my daugthers friend. We spent 6 nights and had a really fantastic holiday. When we arrived we were very lucky to be upgraded. The suite had 2 bedrooms, a big living room with dining table and sofa bed. This was perfect as we then could have breakfast in the room every morning and a few take aways in the evening when we were too tired to move. The staff is very friendly and helpful though I think it is not very clean. The corners and behind doors were rather filthy that is really a shame. The first time I stayed though (at a business trip) I had a new and very fresh room. But again we were so lucky to have this big "flat" and I would stay there again if I got the chance.

Reviews.Title: “last minute trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: lfresa
Reviews.Content: We booked through price line for a last minute hotel needed for the city. We had tickets to Jimmy Fallon for the next day. Location, location, location. Grand Central Terminal was about four blocks away. Hotel was right on Lexington in prime location. Everyone from the front desk to the bell man were gracious. They had the most comfortable beds I had ever slept in. Bathroom was spacious and updated. Room was spotless. Free wifi and a diner next door and a great place across the street for pizza slices. This was a hidden gem and will always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown option”
Reviews.Author: mceli
Reviews.Content: The strongest two aspects of this hotel are the service and value. My wife and I stayed with our three young kids and had our share of special requests which the staff was always very willing to accommodate. In fact, after we left, we realized we had left a bag with some purchases made on the trip. We contacted Jose, one of the staff members, who found our items, packed them, and shipped them from the post office. If you have stayed in NY, you know this kind of service is not the norm. We stayed in one of the corner rooms which had two double beds and a nice amount of space. The room was in good condition, not new, but well maintained. Price was reasonable for midtown Manhattan and was almost certainly lower than neighboring 4- and 5-star places.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctive & Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Vyronas P
Reviews.Content: This place feels less like a hotel and more like someone's home - staying there is like staying with an old friend - a slightly eccentric, idiosyncratic old friend I have to admit, but a welcoming, hospitable one nonetheless. The staff were invariably helpful and pleasant, the room was extremely comfortable and in no way corporate or "off-the-peg" and the food in the restaurant was terrific, while the location was ideal for sightseeing and cultural visits. If you want somewhere special and out of the ordinary to stay in central Manhattan, this is the place to go for.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, the staff is friendly and eager to help. Will definitely be staying here again .

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: NYinhabitant
Reviews.Content: I recently had a wonderfully surreal experience at the Roger Smith. I'm a local--I live in New York--but I was in the neighborhood the night before Thanksgiving, desperate to find a wine store still open at 11 pm so I could give a gift to my hosts the next day. I ducked into the Roger Smith to inquire. I was informed by the three friendly staffers at the desk, including the hilarious but still professional Rajesh Nair, that I was out of luck on that count...although I was not a guest, they put their heads together to try to come with a solution to my predicament and managed to procure me a bottle of wine from their own inventory--with help from an employee who had clocked out for the night. They were funny, helpful and completely welcoming. I would stay at this hotel if I ever had cause to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and engaging.”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith Hotel is unique, and my stay there a unique and delightful experience. At a time when most hotels are part of chains; uniform and uninspired, any single independent would stand out, but the Roger Smith is truly exceptional. From the sidewalk and frontage, the lobby and restaurant and in the rooms, art is on display. Not art as dÃ©cor but, as I soon realised, at the heart of the enterprise. In this creativity an affirmation and generosity that was not only wonderfully present throughout the locale but very evident in the lively, friendly staff.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “A Perfect One Night Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent my birthday weekend at the Roger Smith Hotel. I was pleasantly surprised to find that we were staying in a suite; one that was beautifully decorated, quiet, and incredibly spacious. I know how difficult it is to find hotel rooms in NYC with enough room, and this room completely exceeded our expectations. We thoroughly enjoyed the room, as well as breakfast in the hotel the next morning. The Roger Smith is an excellent choice for a unique stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great expereince at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: i had a great expereince at this property. The room rate was reasonable, the room was very nicely appointed and despite the never ending New York city traffic and street noise outside, it was very quiet which led to a restful night.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected comfort, unusual hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophie d
Reviews.Content: So different from the average hotel...Largest room I have seen in a New York Hotel. In it a collection of books on shelves, real potted plant, brand new television, lots of lamps and good quality black and white photos on the walls. The most memorable part of our stay was the charming, courteous,warm and easy manner of the staff . We liked the works of art which are everywhere. Where they all done by the same artist? Roger Smith?

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: Mysig84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work in September and must say I was surprised by how poorly kept the hotel was. It was kind of a depressing interior which we reminded me of somebody's grandmas house. There were scratches on the doors etc, paint chipping and the bathroom looked like it really needed to be clean properly... I agree with another user that it is strange with the postcard of Roger Smith and Jane Goodall, but I suppose it was a nice thing, in context. Except you realise how old the place is and how out of touch they must be with the modern consumer, but I guess that is what makes it boutique. The positive thing is that it was central and easy to get around. The bed was comfortable and the towels were good quality. But next time if I was going in my own spare time, I definitely wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: ejt77
Reviews.Content: Plus points Large rooms Free wifi Comfy beds (quite firm, but I like that) Friendly staff Minus points Faded glory personified - everything is 20+ years old, but it does have an endearing character... Awful old TV with broken remote control Ancient bathroom and plumbing (shower runs from cool to hot and back again) Lily's restaurant is expensive and distinctly average (go elsewhere to eat) Would I stay here again? Probably, because it's pretty good value and the basics are spot on. You get a good nights sleep and it's well located. I can live with the old bathroom fittings, as I travel for business and it really doesn't matter for the small amount of time I'm in the room. I love the fact that it is unpretentious. I hate hotels like the Intercontinental where you are made to feel like you're doing them a favour for booking in. I've stayed many times at the Intercontinental (6 times in the last year) and despite the hefty price tag their rooms are not much better than the Roger Smith. Old bathrooms abound at the Intercontinental too, likewise the Radisson on Lex. In general, midtown New York hotels are not great when it comes to modernity. I've stayed in a fair few and they all - to a greater or lesser extent - could do with updating. Spending more doesn't guarantee anything better apart from a fancy reception and a guy to hold the door open. The Roger Smith is a pretty good place to lay your head and the price is reasonable. I would argue though that classifying it as a luxury hotel is pushing the boundaries a little too far. Luxury it ain't! But it's a good place nonetheless. Recommended :-)

Reviews.Title: “Weird and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith Hotel was weird and dingy. The postcard with the hotelâ€™s CEO and Dr. Jane Goodall (Chimpanzee expert) holding stuffed animals, that were monkeys of course, was the weird part. The furniture though antique, was better suited for a college fraternity house. I couldnâ€™t tell if the flower patterned chair had mold in the fabric or if it was once a green color that had now faded...I think it was a combination of both. Spattered paint on the carpet, exposed concrete in the doorways, very dusty vanity bulbs, chipped and scratched furniture, mediocre customer service, and a couple of hairs in the tub rounded out my underwhelming experience. I guess I could have kept my mind off the fact that I had to sleep there by reading one of the used paperbacks on the antique bookshelf, but I refrained to avoid getting my hands dirty. Their central location was the saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at new York”
Reviews.Author: smikhailElCajon
Reviews.Content: This is my first real mini vacation to New York, my stay at the a roger Smith Hotel was very pleasant the price cpmetitive the location I'd perfect, the hotel is a bit old but very well kept, the beds are comfortable, the staff are very polite, helpfully and friendly. I wish that they had breakfast too. The rooms well decorated nice colors, my room was by the street so it was a bit noisy, but if you need a great location you have to accept the noise. It was walking distance from every main attraction. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Character and Location in Mid-town”
Reviews.Author: pman383838
Reviews.Content: We had a family suite with a large living room and kitchenette. The kids stayed on the pull out couch in the living room and the second room had a king bed. The hotel staff was very friendly, the housekeeping was prompt. Great location in mid-town. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Allyson25
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Roger Smith in NYC what can we say but it was fab !!! We were in NYC to celebrate my best friends 50th Birthday and the hotel was great from start to finish. Central location, brilliant room we had a corner suite with two beds a sofa and lots of space, the bathroom was lovely and clean too. Staff were very friendly and helpful especially a mention for Manuel on the front desk couldn't do enough to give advice and help us. Also a mention for the guy who was working on Sunday night he brought ice to our room for us and helped us open our bottles as we didn't have a bottle opener. All together a lovely hotel would definetly go back only down side was bar and restaurant was closed for refurbishment I know these things have to be done but was dissapointed it was on our weekend !!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting property”
Reviews.Author: GD2004
Reviews.Content: Huge family suite, friendly staff, and quiet. Could not have asked for more in terms of space and ease. Good location close to the UN, Zag Hammerskald Park (with cool metallic statues), easy walk to Times Square, MOMA, subway, Grand Central Station; easy to catch a cab on Lex to anywhere. Caveats: Some of the furnishings are a little shabby, you will not be seeing 'sleek' here; the housekeeping was friendly but somewhat spotty. You are not going to get a bellman holding the door/concierge/cab hailed for you here. Do you care? I didn't. Across the street from drug store where bottled water, forgotten hair products are easily obtained; several delis for bagels/fruit also just outside the door. We had a fridge and microwave which were very handy. Stay again, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: christso
Reviews.Content: The check in was efficient and the room was larger than expected. Housekeeping was good. The hotel bar was closed and there was construction going on outside early Sunday morning but that"s NYC. I would return no problem.

Reviews.Title: “ok I guess, but certainly not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: TraverlerLambda
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is indeed very well located, and clean. However, it is shabby, old, bathroom is completely outdated (tiles broken, low pressure shower, old and noisy toilet). Given the reviews, the rating and the price that we paid, we were expecting a bit more. Also, our room was directly on Lexington avenue, we were on the 12th floor, but we were still hearing noise from the street. So overall, the hotel is ok, it is clean (which is the most important), but in terms of value (price vs.quality), I would not necessarily return and would rather try another hotel in New York for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Mid Town Gem”
Reviews.Author: dknps
Reviews.Content: Short notice due to leaving another Hotel which was beyond horrible. Stopped in the lobby and spoke to Jim about making a reservation. He put me on the house phone to reservations. I spoke with Suzy who was extremely nice and helpful. Great room, and everyone was very friendly. Randy at the front desk was a wealth of local knowledge and again very nice. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Vincent M
Reviews.Content: Great place! the rooms are like a home away from home. very clean and great service. my boyfriend and i were there on business and the staff made our stay unforgettable. Im even thinking on sending Randy at the front desk a thank you card for all his hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stateomaine
Reviews.Content: Great value and great location (really can't get much closer to GCT and the subway there). Lobby is a bit small compared to the other hotels in this neighborhood (Radisson, Intercontinental, etc), but the rooms are comfortable and don't feel sterile like many chain hotels do. Restaurant not open during our stay which was too bad as we wanted a cocktail while getting dressed for dinner one night. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bethanny1
Reviews.Content: First time in NYC and this is the place to stay! It is clean, beautiful, and centrally located. The staff is so helpful, and Manuel is fantastic. Being tourists from out of state we didn't have a clue how to get anywhere or even what to do. Full of suggestions, and always patient and helpful, Manuel has made our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkmaninlondon
Reviews.Content: What a dump. All I can say. Tattered everything, old fixtures. Two guys duct-taping a 50 year old airconditioner together when I walked in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, quirky small hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1060WestAddison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roger Smith Hotel with three friends for a "girls weekend." We were upgraded to a suite, which was wonderful. The living area was a comfortable place to lounge around, with plenty of room to fix drinks and snacks. The kitchenette has a small refrigerator and dishes ~ a nice bonus. The separate bedroom had comfortable beds, though they are small for double beds. The bathroom had a nice shower and plenty of room for getting ready to go out. The location of the hotel is outstanding for heading out for shopping or hitting the town at night. There are a few downsides to the Roger Smith ... First, the front desk staff, while friendly, are very slow. It took us a very long time to get checked in (though that's how we ended up with the upgraded room, so I'm not complaining!) and checked out. The air conditioner in our room would not work. Thankfully the windows do open a bit, so we were able to keep it from getting too hot. As I mentioned above, the beds are tiny. There was a queen-size sofa bed in our suite, which was a good addition. The hotel is older and it's a bit quirky (iron headboards, mismatched upholstery), but I personally found it to be a better option that the homogenous Hyatt or Marriott. Overall, I would recommend the Roger Smith Hotel. If you're staying for more than a day, definitely look into getting a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ann L
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter to NYC for the weekend to do all the usual things. The Roger Smith was perfect. We stayed in one of the suites and it was very comfortable. The sheets were so nice. The room was huge, and we really felt at home. The traditional design and furniture is tranquil, and comfortable. I love that each time I stay there is new cool art all over the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Midtown boutique...Roger Smith Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nico129
Reviews.Content: From that first glance at the entrance, with the statues and well appointed design as you walk inside, you're brought into a different style and taste of luxury. The Roger Smith Hotel sits among some major chain hotels, but has a unique class and allure that you soak up right away. The pleasant & helpful staff plus the old-style textures grab and relax you after a long day of business & travel. It'll certainly be a place for me to stay when I'm in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, individual feel and free internet access!”
Reviews.Author: kmn727
Reviews.Content: If you want a brilliantly located hotel in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of just about everywhere you might want to go, you can't do better than the Roger Smith. The rooms have really attractive pieces of furniture in them that really encourage you to relax. My room the first night was a little noisy (Lex Ave was right below), but the staff kindly found me another room. Tea and coffee facilities in the room means just coffee, but don't despair; there's a Duane Reade two doors away for emergency tea supplies. There's also an eclectic selection of books in rooms too. While I was there the restaurant was closed for redecoration, but nearby breakfast options were plentiful. I really resent paying lots of money for internet access; they seem to get that at the Roger Smith; it's free. Another plus if you're travelling light is that you can take the airtrain/subway to/from JFK airport in less than an hour; the subway stop is just a few blocks further up Lexington Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located hotel to visit the main tourist attractions in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: trantor2312
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its excellent location in Midtown Manhattan (Lexington Ave). Rooms are clean and comfortable, but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “The most courteous staff of any hotel I have patronized centrally located in manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: Jakeman29
Reviews.Content: I have already stayed in this hotel four times within this last year. The employees are courteous and friendly as well as helpful. The rooms are very clean, and it is located a few short blocks from grand central station. With all this hotel has to offer, the price is more than competitive. Great value without sacrificing quality. 2 THUMBS UP

Reviews.Title: “Good value on Lexington Ave.”
Reviews.Author: danville
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after my son's college graduation. Needed a room with 2 beds. Very comfortable room and beds and in a great location for a very good price. They have a small outdoor bar on one of the top floors that most people don't know about that has a nice view. Front desk was very helpful and they offer off-site parking. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/tiniest bathroom ever in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Half_runner
Reviews.Content: Because we were there for the US Open, we chose a hotel with close proximity to Grand Central. The room was a nice size, but as noted in other reviews, the AC is very outdated. I haven't seen a room airconditioner in a hotel in 40+ years! It worked well enough (we kept it at high cool 24 hrs/day) but outside temp was only in the low 80s each day. If it had been hotter, I don't think it would have kept the room cool enough. The bathroom however, was ridiculously small and had absolutely no ventilation. It had a moldy smell as a result. Even though it was old, our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Also, avoid the rooftop bar. We went up for a quick pre-theatre snack one night and quickly gave up on that idea! The menu was terribly limited and the service was slow. It's a great idea to have a rooftop bar, but this one needs a major menu and service overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kristen S
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Roger Smith Hotel for the 3rd time since November 2010 (made a mistake and stayed at another hotel in April this year). The front desk always offers a warm welcome and makes you immediately feel at home. The rooms are extremely comfortable and very large for NYC. The artwork on exhibit at the hotel is always an added bonus. I love this hotel and will never have to search again for accommodations in the city. I look forward to my upcoming visits in November and April.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty is all I can say”
Reviews.Author: izhaarose
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a five night stay at this hotel and am very unhappy with the rooms, the cleanliness of the hotel and the staff who seemed quite disinterested and disengaged in my opinion. The suite was old with stains on the carpet everywhere you looked. The furniture was outdated, scratched, torn and smelled very musty. Air conditioning unit needed to be fixed. Housekeeeping was poor as the suite was vacuumed once during our stay and the bathroom was not kept clean at all. The king bed was lumpy and creaked every time you moved and the sofa bed was like sleeping on the metal coils themselves. I am not sure why people give this hotel such a great review. I for one would never recommend this place to anyone and when speaking to some local residents at a restaurant in Soho they assured me that this hotel is not known for style or comfort... Sure the room was spacious but I would much rather have comfort and cleanliness than a couple of extra feet.

Reviews.Title: “New York's Finest! Cleanest and Friendliest Hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Nicholson
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Roger Smith Hotel on a recommendation from a friend. I am a seasoned traveler and have stayed all over the world. Not only was the hotel charming and clean, but the staff was friendly and accommodating at every turn. If you are looking for exceptional service, above par cleanliness and a great location, you MUST stay here! In fact, I never take the time to write reviews or recommendations about where I stay or how I felt about the hotel. This hotel is a must see, must stay location and I am grateful it was recommended to me. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Artsy, quaint, opportunity for more...”
Reviews.Author: hereweare2006
Reviews.Content: Centrally located so we were able to access the nearby attractions easily...with a 3 year old. Great art and figures all over to view. Unique style that felt artsy. The size and dimensions felt cozy, not too oversized nor tight. We were unable to utilize the roof top bar due to day and time of day we arrived and the downstairs bar/resturant was closed early (I think 5pm) which I thought odd for New York City... We were greeted but not overly friendly. The room was quaintly and comfortably decorated, 2 comfy beds (high for child though) with plush linens, brand new TV but I would recommend checking the AC first! Would revisit and stay there again. Booked online....

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs (but everything else was nice)”
Reviews.Author: eggplantlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roger Smith Hotel on Lexington for 4 nights in late June 2011. After returning home I experienced the nightmare of bed bug bites. I went to my doctor and he gave me a letter confirming the presence of bed bug bites. I wrote to The Hotel and asked for reasonable compensation. They responded by saying that they inspected the room and could not find any evidence of bed bugs. The inspection took place 6 weeks after my stay so their regular pesticide treatment may have already taken care of the bed bugs, or perhaps they 'just couldn't find them'. Nine weeks later I still have scars from the bites. Their customer service in relation to this event was cold and totally unsatisfactory. I was not expecting a total reimbursement from my stay but they couldn't even offer an apologetic meal gratis during my next stay in New York. I will NEVER stay at ANY of the Roger Smith Hotels again, which is really a shame because it was a charming, older style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best "boutique" hotels in NYC and great value”
Reviews.Author: JosephSloboda
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roger Smith hotel about 17 times over the last 10 years and every time is better than the last. Seems that every time I come to NYC and stay somewhere else I end up saying "I wish I was at the Smith". While some of the rooms are small, the suites are great, like little apartments. The staff in this hotel is top notch and is incredibly helpful in every way. There are fantastic restaurants and good deli all within a short walk. Also Grand Central is just a short 5 block walk which is super convenient. The place is very clean, food is good, staff is always great. If they have rooms available you should stay here, . . . Joe Sloboda

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you get the right price”
Reviews.Author: Al_Kuz
Reviews.Content: My sister, nephew and myself went to New York this May. Looked for appropriate place to stay at reasonable price and failed at first. Normally I go to NYC few times a year, but on my own. Going there with famility is a challenge from the "hotel" point of view. Found really the best rate directly at hotel's website (it was the best, comparing to other sites). Hotel room was spacious. Decoration of the room was sweet, but little bit tired. Reception was super friendly and helpful. Generally, if you are traveling with family and want to stay centrally - this is an option. Still, the hotel is slightly washed-out, so take it only if you can get a deal for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Spacious Hotel for New York”
Reviews.Author: efrederick
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews and was a little nervous going into this hotel, but a friend of mine that lived in NYC recommended it so I trusted her. All in all it was good. The hotel room felt like you were staying at your Grandma's house, or an east coast B&B. The room was very spacious. I've stayed in a few hotels in NYC for work that were a lot more $ per night and the rooms were tiny, but the Rogers Smith was a great size. It is VERY close to all the NYC areas; Broadway (we went and say How to Succeed in Business - highly recommend), Times Square, Central Park and shopping on Park Ave. The Staff didn't blow me away with customer service, however i wouldn't say they were rude or anything either. One of the best parts about the rooms is they all have mini fridges in them. There is a drug store and a liquor store right across the street, so we bought some stuff for a night cap. My only complaint is that there is something up with the water there; when you take a shower without even touching the faucets the water fluctuates between very hot to very cold and back to very hot again. The last day we were there they posted a note saying that someone was going to be in to fix the water...so they seemed to be aware of the problem. If you are looking for elegance, great customer service, and high class this isn't the hotel for you, but if you want a cheaper hotel that is close to everything and a comfy bed to sleep in - this is the place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DG1972
Reviews.Content: Having lived in the city in my younger days, My wife and I have travled back and forth for weekend visits a few times a year staying in hotels all around the city. Finding The Roger Smith on line, turns out to be a great find. This visit we decided to take our 4 young children with us for their first time to the city. First off the greeting staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was clean and comfortable for all 6 of us and the location was perfect. check out at noon hotel staff held our bags for the day for us to enjoy the rest of our trip. I would love to stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “As good as we remembered”
Reviews.Author: AlanFS
Reviews.Content: We first stopped at The Roger Smith for 1 night in 2009 -don't ask, the wife screwed our dates up and we had to leave the apartment we had rented. Anyway, from the time we phoned them and arrived all stressed up at the front door they were first class. Fantastic service, very good rooms and facilities and a real haven, superbly located on Lexington in Mid Town. We had to return to NYC for 5 nights in July this year and didn't hesitate to re-book with them, and we weren't disappointed. The online booking with Galo was excellent and very efficiently carried out. Front desk staff - special mentions to Kacuk and Manny, were brilliant throughout our stay and provided every assistance needed, when needed. The rooms were excellently sized with good facilities, clean and well maintained.And the breakfasts were wonderful, with great choice, good portions and definitely set us up for those busy NY days. Location wise, it takes some beating for those that want to base themselves centrally for visiting as many of the sites as possible. Without doubt the best hotel I have stayed in in New York and for the money is in my opinion hard to beat. I will definitely go back. Only one moan, well not really but it would be wonderful if they could make a kettle available for the rooms for us Brits who just have to have our morning cuppa and cannot be doing with those darned coffee machines.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel....loved it”
Reviews.Author: GingerNewYork3
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a weekend retreat at the hotel and had a deluxe suite. Staff is friendly, accommodations were excellent and we all had a fab time...highly recommend the Roger Smith Hotel in Midtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Charming”
Reviews.Author: Twix14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our fifteen daughter and her friend spent three days at the Roger Smith in a deluxe suite on the 6th floor.We took advantage of discount offer that the hotel had posted on its website in June when I made the reservations for July. We got a wonderful deal. Omar greeted us, took care of our luggage and valet parking. The desk staff is friendly and caring. Our room was clean and spacious.The paintings are a nice touch as well. There was an entrance hall into the living room. We had a living/dining area, small kitchen, a large master bedroom and a smaller twin room. I was also amazed at the closets: one walk-in and two others. The housekeepers do a wonderful job of taking care of the room, always proving clean towels and fresh sheets. You will feel like you are walking into an apartment, like home. The white sofas and chairs are comfy with plenty of decorative pillows. The mirrors make the room feel even larger. Our bedroom had three windows and the sunlight was welcome. The bathroom is small, but it suited our needs. Keep in mind, this is an older hotel and may not have all the frills, but we did not mind at all. We were in 611 right by the elevator, in an end room. At first I was concerned that it might be noisy, but it was not a problem. The air conditioning is fine if you pull back the long sheers. Our rooms were always cool. The location is wonderful-close enough to walk to the theater district, but far enough away from all the crowds. It's also just a few blocks from the United Nations and Grand Central. We also walked to the MOMA. Check out Longwoods, a gourmet cafe across the street from the hotel. We had a reasonable breakfast and lunch there. We felt very safe in this area. I almost forgot, internet is free, fast and worked great. When we left, our car was brought around within twenty minutes. We will certainly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Midtown, Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: outsols
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith Hotel is a family owned,boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan, Our room was spacious and comfortable, and the people who work there friendly and cooperative. We were told about the hotel by a Manhattan resident and we were glad we followed her advice to stay in the Roger Smith. The hotel is one block from the Waldorf, three from the Chrysler Building and two from the nearest subway station. It is also within walking distance of Times Square and the Theater District. My daughter and I truly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JBFlyGirl
Reviews.Content: We had no trouble checking into the hotel, even though we arrived before the official check in time. We got a room on the 3rd Floor, and even though we were close to the elevator, we never heard any noise. We also did not hear much noise from the street, and our room looked out over Lexington Avenue. The room was very clean, the staff was very nice and always smiling, and able to serve guests in English and in Spanish. While the breakfast and meals at their restaurant were expensive, you really did not have to eat there, because there are so many alternatives in the area. The hotel is walking distance from Grand Central Station, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Music Hall, and a host of other New York landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Pleasant and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: MAFestus
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute trip to the city. Have not been in years and had no idea where to stay. We literally called for reservations the day of. Nice room. Was spacious, comfy beds, clean bathroom. Totally worked for us. Floral wallpaper was not our style, but clean and convenient and reasonably priced were what we were looking for. I would definitely stay here again! The staff at the front desk were really helpful and did not seem disgusted with our silly touristy questions. They gave us some nice pointers and offered coupons for area attractions. Within walking distance to Times Square, The Top of the Rock, Empire State Building, M&M store. If you want a great burger, try Connelly's Pub down the street. Good value for your buck! Valet parking is $35 also a good value for the city! We even had a suburban.

Reviews.Title: “Don't redeem points to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Piper5078
Reviews.Content: Several friends had suggested staying here. The website made the hotel look great- convenient location to trains, the decor looked thoughtful not sterile and the reviews were great. My experience did not live up to that. I used travel points to book a room, and ended up with an old fashion room, with old fashion plumbing, cable and an old air conditioner that was not up to the task of a New York City night in June. The air in the room was stale, and though it was supposedly a no smoking floor, smelled faintly of smoke. It was not the most pleasant stay. Additionally, every interaction with the staff was interrupted by them either helping other guests in the middle or answering phone calls - not just once but continuously. What should have been a three minute interaction took over 10. Had I been paying full costs, I would have to say the experience did not match the price, even given that it was a New York City hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Fails to Please”
Reviews.Author: Indy0403
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Roger Smith since I was a student in High School, attending UN student functions, in 1958. Over the years I've seen this hotel go through many rebirths. The transitions have always been done well, even though some rooms occasionally seemed to lag behind others, and perhaps didn't get the attention they needed as quickly as possible. However, never have I been disappointed by the staff, their service, their genuine concern for each guest, and their ability to quickly address you by name as you enter the lobby. That means a lot to a weary traveler in the city with a reputation for being impersonal. The newest rebirth of this hotel is once again, no disappointment. It's still my home away from home. It's almost as though I've had a decorator redo my favorite stop on the road! Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Finally MY place in Midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: thorvaldBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: For years I have hopped from hotel to hotel in Midtown NYC, generally finding them (1) overpriced, (2) overhyped, or (3) tiny. Or all of the above. I will be returning to Roger Smith. I'd been here in April and liked it. In June, I had the good fortune of getting the one bedroom suite (unfortunately, one of those super-expensive weeks ...) and it worked like a wonder. I was able to have business meetings in my living room, wine with friends, and generally function feeling relaxed. Staff was gracious and efficient, and everybody sported a ready smile that was not part of the "hi my name is xxxx, I'm your server tonight, enjoy" synthetic customer care that so irritates me. Morning coffee with the Manager, Ek Wongleecharoen was fun and educational. I think I will be pleased to make this my home for future visits in NYC. And something I appreciated was not being nickel-and-dimed for internet, which worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nynative72
Reviews.Content: The first thing thing that struck me about the hotel was the friendly staff. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left every employee we encountered was wonderful. We had two rooms at the hotel and both of them were uniquely decorated. At a lot of hotels you feel as if you are staying at a hotel. At the Roger Smith, you feel like you are staying at a home away from home. It has a great location and everything we wanted to do was easily accessible. The attached restaurant/bar had great food, great staff and is reasonably priced. The next time I visit NYC I will definitely stay at the Roger Smith!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WK001
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Roger Smith and it did not disappoint. The staff are magnificent; I was recovering from an emergency operation and they went out of their way to be helpful and seemed genuinely concerned. They upgraded me to a suite which was fantastic. The location is excellent and it is like a home away from home. I strongly recommend it; and the prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: GeorgetownDC
Reviews.Content: Love staying at the Roger Smith Hotel. The staff are so friendly and warm, and the service is excellent. Especially love the artwork. Great location, close to everything - will definitely be back. And the wireless is free!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent cost/benefit”
Reviews.Author: FabioRosa
Reviews.Content: Great location, excelent peopme attending and fair cost.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again”
Reviews.Author: slimygit
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith is a nice boutique hotel. It's not new and shiny, but the staff are great (Sophie was especially helpful during our stay), the location is great, the amenities are very welcoming, and the price could be a lot worse. Look for promos to save a few bucks, and enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “This was one of our best picks in nyc hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: lara7645
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our choice of hotel! The staff was friendly, the room was spacious and clean, and the location was great. We'll definitely return! The only negative was that the rooftop bar is not open on the weekends. The accommodating staff did let us take drinks from the bar onto the rooftop, though!! We LOVE Roger Smith Hotel and we'll definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “This was one of our best picks in nyc hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: lara7645
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our choice of hotel! The staff was friendly, the room was spacious and clean, and the location was great. We'll definitely return! The only negative was that the rooftop bar is not open on the weekends. The accommodating staff did let us take drinks from the bar onto the rooftop, though!! We LOVE Roger Smith Hotel and we'll definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from room 609 or any room that has not been remodelled, terrible, terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: autumnleaves9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dingy, dirty, and smells like an old basement. The room I stayed in had worm carpet, mold on the bath tub/shower, the phone was broken, the alarm clock was broken, and I could hear the person in the next room ALL NIGHT yelling on the phone. At $250/night, I did not expect a 1 star motel in need of repair. Truly a terrible experience. If you have any other options, take that, but do not stay at the Roger Smith.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: trishsargeant
Reviews.Content: 5 people in two rooms --- a junior suite and deluxe suite with a total cost of $5000 for a week. Our junior suite was disgusting. Filthy walls and carpet with a huge patch, a wine top on the floor, dust and rings on the furniture and a dirty bathroom with toothpaste everywhere and a sink that was backed up. No contact from management to apologize or move us even after several calls. Room was cleaned a little but I would definitely not return or recommend. My family in the deluxe suite had major issues as well. Front desk people are not empowered to resolve any problems and defer to management who never follow up while you are a guest. Poor customer service and "ick" factor in bathroom and carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, cosy and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: DrHouse7
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes you feel like home, but more coddled! Staff is very kind and helpful, rooms are neat - all different! - and the breakfast is marvellous! The Eggs Florentine was the best we ever had! I I highly recommend it and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice and cosy !”
Reviews.Author: Cherrymoon76
Reviews.Content: We were in New York for 4 days, just to check out the city, have a feel of it etc...we travelled with our 2 and a half year-old daughter, so we were looking for a place close to everything by foot, safe, cosy and a suite, so when she goes to bed, we can still have a chat and a drink in the lounge without waking her up...At the Roger Smith Hotel, we found just that...we stayed in room 311, and to our surprise, not only the suite was very spacious , comfortable and cozy, but there was also an extra smaller bedroom , which was perfect to fit a crib in there for her, and not have to disturb her sleep when we went to bed later in the evening... Location is superb, if one is used to walk, all is nearby, Central Park,5th and Madison ave, Rockefeller center, Times Square, Broadway theater district, a short cab ride away to the main ferries etc... There is no room service, but a nice little cafe downstairs that you can order food from and take it up to your room, or quite a few cafes and delis right on Lexington avenue...After all, this is NYC, food is all around ! The only thing my husband and I were disappointed in, was the babysitting service...: on the saturday, we planned to go and watch a musical in Broadway ( prepaid tickets), and as such, i called the hotel 10 days earlier to book a babysitter for the night... We booked from 7pm to 11pm, and at check-in, i did get a note to reconfirm the babysitting booking on that night... At 0710pm, we were still waiting for somebody to turn up, i called reception and asked what was happening, after 10 mns, i got told they had the booking confused and thought it was for the following night...apparently, the mistake was the babysitting agency, not the hotel...so they could still get somebody there after a half hour wait, which wasn't good enough as our show started at 0800 pm... That was the only frustrating part, especially as the gentleman at reception ( i won't mention his name) was quite rude and didn't seem to understand my disappointment, he never once apologised, luckily we dealt with the manager on duty later on, that was very nice, and kept an eye on our sleeping daughter for us, while we were away... I just need to mention that my daughter is a sound sleeper, 12 hours a night, so it kind of worked out, but if she wasn't, or needed to be entertained, we would have missed the show and lost $500 worth of tickets... So to you parents who plan to stay at the Roger Smith, do reconfirm again that a babysitter is coming, even one hour before you leave...just in case...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raven288
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at. Nice rooms. Very good location. Fairly close to Grand Central Terminal. Good value for the location. Staff is very attentive. This was the second time we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't check in at night!”
Reviews.Author: mbiz
Reviews.Content: I used to like this euro-centric - mostly small country Europe for some reason - hotel, but less so now. It has been renovated. Bathrooms are very nice, rooms funky 'British library' style. But front desk at night is an excruciatingly slow one man no-show and even during the day check in is understaffed and slow. And the manager (?) was found hanging in the bar. Internet is slow and not very stable. There's better in the same price range, so only at a real discount...

Reviews.Title: “Staff!”
Reviews.Author: GerardoJ
Reviews.Content: I would love to compliment the Roger Smith Hotel on having exceptional staff. In particular, Randy, Omar and Jim! They went over and above and beyond any expectations that I had. They were also extremely helpful and helped to make my stay great! Randy especially had excellent banter and was more than willing to help everyone at all times!!! By Gerardo Jaconelli

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LafayetteHS
Reviews.Content: Large, comfortable room; excellent service; free internet; east side midtown location

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0utAndAb0utAgain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem among the sterile big hotels that seem to dominate in Manhattan. Big, clean rooms, very friendly staff, and very comfortable beds at a reasonable price add up to a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming. Lovely atmosphere, small hotel feel, well located, good bed”
Reviews.Author: thecatsmiaow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was a comfortable room, with a great bed. Our room had tasteful furniture, which gave it a slightly genteel European feel. We appreciated having the small kitchenette, which allowed us to prepare packed lunches for long days out, and a fridge to keep the bubbly chilled. Staff were friendly yet unobtrusive. Hotel is well located near the green line, and on east side of Manhattan, making it easy to travel to most places, including Grand Central station, 5th Avenue and Brooklyn. Would definitely consider staying here again. The only grizzle would be that our son found the sofa bed uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SASY302
Reviews.Content: It was a big room, with two double beds, nice for the $, would so stay again! Nice staff, helpful and close to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.. business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: The_Redbeard
Reviews.Content: I come down to the city every few months for work. I usually stay at another hotel in the area, but was unhappy with the amenities. In my search, I found Roger Smith. This trip was split between bringing my family for a few days, and then a few days at the office. When we arrived, the staff was very friendly and we were checked in quickly. The lobby was nice, and the artwork interesting. When we got to the room (a double/double) we were very happy. As my wife put it, it was "homey". It felt more like a B&B than a hotel in midtown. Location-wise, it's a great place. It's an easy walk to Rockefeller Center, Times Square and there are plenty of choices to eat around the block. It was also easy to catch a cab outside, and Grand Central is around the corner. I had a great time with my family, and we all enjoyed the hotel. When my family checked out, and I was going to check back in (for my business portion), there was an issue with my reservation. The staff quickly made up for the situation by upgrading me to a one bedroom suite. It was more than I could have asked for, and the room was fantastic. It was very nice to spread out, and there is certainly enough room to entertain friends or associates. But, even being alone, it felt like a little home away from home and made my stay much more enjoyable. In all, both rooms were nice.. and I think it's neat that neither was exactly the same. Unlike many hotels where the rooms are cookie-cutter, the rooms were similar enough to have continuity, but different enough to be interesting. The coffee maker was nice, the mini-fridge was great, and the microwave in the suite was handy. The wifi was useful for both work, and having the family be able to check email and Facebook during some downtime. The staff was friendly, and very helpful. Negatives? The heater seemed to have a mind of its own. Or, at least I couldn't turn it off. I just opened the window, so it wasn't a big deal. Although they offer a large selection of DVDs, there were some TV channels that aren't available (a few news channels, and Nick). A positive stay, a great location and value, and I will be using them for now on when I come down to the city for work (and pleasure).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: sanders8336
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is the most run-down and amenity-free establishment I have ever stayed in, and mind you, I am not high maintenance. I gladly stay at The Hyatt Place or Hampton Inn (so just know that my standards are not too high). In my one night there, I was forced to change rooms three times because the radiators were blasting hot air and could not be turned off. There was no a/c in the first two rooms, and in one of the rooms I could not open a window to try to let the heat escape. In the final room, I was assured there was a/c, but the unit was so old and dirty that I was afraid to have air circulate through the unit. Disgusting. I slept with the window open the entire night and lucky had ear plugs with me so that I could drown out the NYC traffic noises. Without a doubt, this was the worst hotel experience of my life. I so wish I had paid attention to the reviews on the web about the Roger Smith Hotel instead of assuming that the conference planners who suggested it had my best interests in mind. But, hey, the good news is that I didn't find a single bed bug when I checked all three mattresses!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy access to Grand Central and Times Square; professional staff, cute rooms, comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: BeccaAggie
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC with my Mom twice a year; over spring break and in the Summer. We've stayed at other hotels in the city but nothing compares! We took the train in from Albany and arrived early, they were able to find us a room and accommodated us with two separate beds, I believe the mattresses had been replaced because they were brand new from the look and feel of it. Our room was a standard room but we still felt like it was an upgrade, the bathroom had floor to ceiling marble, with a jetted tub!!! We asked for ice and they actually brought it up to us in 5 minutes, the staff was very attentive and professional which is a welcomed gift! On the 16th floor there is a balcony that you can see NYC from most angles and in the summer they serve drinks up there!!! We love to go for walks and we were able to walk to Rockefeller center, through times square and back to the hotel with energy to spare. All in all, you can't go wrong with the RS!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: SpainStro
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a better place to lay my head on a much-needed escape to New York and will certainly recommend the Roger Smith for anyone headed to NY who would appreciate the non-corporate feel of a nice little hotel in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. My kudos and thanks to the entire team at the Roger Smith for excellent service and attention to every detail. I look forward to planning my next visit so I can take full advantage of all the amenities, from the hotel's arrangement with New York Sports Clubs to an amazing array of DVDs to exciting cuisine at Lily's, art exhibitions, and Sunday concerts.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: walter95
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us from family members that had here stayed here several years ago. The staff was extremely helpful!! The room we stayed in was the premium suite, which was basically a nice size one bedroom apt.The bedroom had a king size bed,smaller bedrom had a twin and the sofa in the living room had a sleeper sofa.There was a small kitchen with fridge and a microwave. Location was within walking distance of grand central, rock. center, empire state building.Did i mention the staff was GREAT.There were several decent places/deli's close by (cafe metro/ longwood's). Rafael gave us the # of a really great pizza place that delivered. Would stay there again. Make sure to find out who Roger Smith "is"?

Reviews.Title: “Room looked nothing like the website photos”
Reviews.Author: JTCS1980
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC to get engaged and thankfully she said yes! Aside from the lovely time we had in the city, the hotel was a bit of a disappointment. The website images make it look styish and modern, yet the room we had was dated and tatty. Also, the breakfast is very average and expensive... mainly, because the waiters pretend they can't hear your order properly and push your bill above the threshold for a much larger tip by giving you items that you didn't order. All-in-all not a keeper, definitely not a hotel we would recommend and won't be returning...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: peanut321
Reviews.Content: Almost like a bed and breakfast. The room was a little dated, but had nice touches like the books and the wrought iron beds. The staff was great and very helpful. I loved the DVDs we could borrow. The umbrella in the closet - what a nice touch since the weather wasn't the greatest. Only two things - the cable didn't work for CBS so we missed football games and our favorite show. The hotel said they had been "working" on it. I asked for how long and they said few days. That was very upsetting. The second thing was the heat - it was either freezing in the room or very hot. There was no happy medium though we had it looked at twice. Other than that a perfect location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A NYC Hotel We will Use Again!”
Reviews.Author: FDRWife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite a bit, for both business and pleasure. We have stayed at a few different hotels in NYC, and never returned to any of them. The other hotels were all big brand chains. They were impersonal, unfriendly, and generally unpleasant. None of this could be said of the Roger Smith Hotel. We met a number of people who stay at the Roger Smith whenever they are in the city. So, what makes this hotel so special? 1. The small but intimate lobby with changing art installations. 2. The friendly and professional staff. 3. The size of the room. We had a junior suite for an excellent rate, and it was huge by modern hotel room standards. 4. The decor - Very warm and inviting. 5. The quiet! Yes...the quiet in NYC. We were on the 13th floor and we had our window open for the fresh air (don't laugh). Yes, we could hear horns and sirens, but everything quieted down after midnight. And, if it is too loud for you, they have earplugs at the front desk. There was some sort of club thing going on on Saturday night, and we didn't hear a thing! 6. Location - Just a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station, where you can catch a train and where there are loads of places to eat. Great Pizza! 7. We didn't have children with us, but there were a number of people who did, and they all found the rooms very comfortable for a family. All in all we will definitely return to this hotel, and I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Unique small hotel with warm-hearted staff”
Reviews.Author: Francesco_D3
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of small, personal, privately owned hotel that has become nearly impossible to find in this country--especially in New York. The staff are extraordinarily accommodating. There has been a little wear and tear, and the rooms facing Lexington Avenue can be noisy, but the comfort and hospitality easily outweigh those factors. The phrase that sums up the Roger Smith, for me, is generosity of spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Once Loved This Hotel...Never Again!!! Don't Waste Your Time with the E-Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Bellissimogirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than a dozen times in the past few years. I referred many people as well who have stayed here because I recommended the charm, the location and the lovely staff. Unfortunately, when we were here in August 2010, I was unimpressed by the disinterested staff but assumed that it was an anomoly. We arrived last night at 12 am after a 6 hour trip from the west coast. The man at the front desk waited 5 minutes to acknowledge us while he completed his paperwork. We had booked a double doubele on the website after we had competed the reservation "non-refundable" at which time we were offered an "e-standby" upgrade for $9 extra a night for a junior suite ( $27 total for our 3 night stay) if that type of room was available at check-in which we, of course, accepted (particularly since it indicated that this upgrade opportunity was a great savings!) However, when we check-in the man at the front desk told us it would be $30 per night for the upgrade even though that junior suites were available.
