We asked why they had offered it at $9 and he did not answer but when pressed said that "its just busienss' (on checking later we saw that the website was offering the room at $30 over the room that we had already taken so it was just the regular rate). When we said that it was false advertising, he just said "well welcome to New York". His attitude was so rude and really disappointing after other experiences at this hotel. I'm not sure why they bother adding the e-standby ugrade to their website when they did not intend to honor it,but it was a waste of time considering it when it was just a ruse. Usually the somewhat shabby rooms, poor TV reception and lack of other amenities has been acceptable considering the positive attributes but this experience was beyond reproach. Once we got to our room, it was extra shabby, the bathroom was dirty with hair on the toilet and there were parties oin the next room and the room above. If, this was not a non-refundable room, I would leave. Oddly enough, the room that we were given after the ordeal with the front desk is one which was added by another Trip Advisor user as their shappy room which, I believe, was another dig by the front desk clerk. Honestly, I will advise all my friends who have patronized this hotel on my recommendation to find other accommodations and I will not be able to come here again with good conscience. I am an avid user of Trip Advisor when deciding on my hotels and I will tell you honestly to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “old world charm”
Reviews.Author: barristerbrent
Reviews.Content: Each time I enter the Roger Smith I feel as though I am transported back to the elegant old family run hotels of London from my childhood. From the charming, helpful staff to the delightful rooms, I truly feel at home. As the director of a social service agency, I travel on a very small budget so this hotel fits all my needs: convenient, safe and utterly cozy. and the extra bonus is that the windows actually open so I can breath fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: rgnewman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Jr. Suite that slept four. The bed was comfortable, and the room had plenty of space. Good pullout sofa. Loved the feel of the room. Raffles the nearby coffee shop is really good for breakfast or lunch. Easy walk to Times Square, Bloomingdale's etc. Homey. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachCal
Reviews.Content: I decided at the last minute to stay over night in the city for New Year's Eve. I don't know why I was surprised, but most of the hotels in the city were either sold-out or doubled their rates. While surfing the net I came across CheapTickets.Com. I was surprised at how inexpensive The Roger Smith hotel was, so I called for verification. And Yes it was true. I arrived expecting to find a dump, but the place was clean and functional. Not exactly the Hilton but cozy and charming. The bathroom was clean and they provided me with plenty of towels. The only draw backs: bed to soft for my taste, never once saw the doorman and you must walk at least 6 blocks to the subway. Other than that I loved it and would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure, will never stay anywhere else in Manhattan again!”
Reviews.Author: hwd74
Reviews.Content: We travelled up over Christmas with 3 children, including two teenagers. We got the junior suite. First, the staff was extremely helpful, and the hotel is quite unique. The room didn't feel like a hotel room, it felt like an apartment. It was very roomy and the details like crown molding, and radiators made it feel like we were in a home and not a hotel. There was plenty of space and the accomodations were clean, centrally located, and had all the creature comforts we desired. We stayed in the Hyatt for two days after and there was no comparison. Heck, the hotel had free internet - something the Hyatt doesn't have. I will never stay anywhere else when we visit Manhattan again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: DVM57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a jr. suite and a regular queen room. Both were fantastic. Large and very comfortable. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We couldn't have had a better trip. I will definately stay there again. Great location for seeing all the must see sights during our 3 day trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Return year after year”
Reviews.Author: Vdenn Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I love the Roger Smith Hotel. Location, easy to get everything I need within a 5 minute walk, I normally stay in the suite and its feels like home. The staff has been there year after year and welcome me by name, and are very interested that my needs are met. Its not a modern hotel, it has art on the walls, comfy chairs, and nice comforter on beds. I have never had a bad experience there, and have been staying there for over 10 years. If you want a boutique feel hotel at a good price, RS has it.

Reviews.Title: “The best of old NY charm, service and cleanliness. We loved our stay.”
Reviews.Author: gmoney54
Reviews.Content: One of the most relaxing and enjoyable settings we've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “My Dream Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ruthiemBoston
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York City for business on a fairly regular basis and given a choice I would never stay anywhere other than the Roger Smith - the art exhibits, many bookshelves, friendly staff, small scale, central location, comfy rooms...it all combines to make me feel like I am in a home away from home even when my meetings in the city are a bit stressful. It makes me sad that the two previous reviewers were so off base because I recently recommended the hotal to a friend and she was turned off when she saw those two reviews. So here I am to say - this hotel is wonderful and I plan to bring my whole family here to stay on winter break.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and Old”
Reviews.Author: brit_chick98
Reviews.Content: It's always a worry when a veteran cab driver says in his 20 years+ he has never once driven anyone to this hotel - and it was very clear why when we pulled up. The tacky entrance was not the way you should be greeted to a hotel in my opinion it was shoddy looking from the outside and didn't get any better inside. Starting with at least one positive comment - the hotel was very centrally located within walking distance of grand central station, times square etc. The staff were friendly as well although greeting me with "welcome back" when I had never been to the hotel before was a bit odd. Sigh...then you get to the room...As you step in, you are immediately assaulted by head ache inducing blue floral wallpaper (yes, wallpaper!) a grotty carpet that looks like it's been there since the 1920's and the weirdest furniture I've seen in a long time - think Faux Chippendale dresser, paired with a pine desk. After the initial shock, that's when you really start to take notice of the other elements in the room...from the sink in the middle of the room (i tease you not) to the portable TV circa 1984, to the bed with glass bed knobs, to the wilted potted plants - and my favorite, the laminated picture cards of - one presumes - Roger Smith himself from the 1970's. - WHY??! On the plus side, the room was quite spacious for a NY hotel, the bed was comfortable, they had free wi-fi in the rooms and the shower was powerful - although tiny so the shower curtain tried to stick to you (gross). Honestly, I'm sure somewhere somebody thinks this outdated stale look is "quaint" well - it "aint". The hotel had no fitness center, no business center and was wholly inappropriate for a business traveler. The sad thing is that it wasn't like this was $175 a night - this was a $299 a night room. Honestly, there are some really cute hotels in New York - do not dampen your time in the city by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rlynbrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Thanksgiving and loved it. The staff were very nice and accommodating, the rooms were good size for NYC and the location was amazing. The only down side was they offer free DVD's which is great but our room did not have a dvd player. They did say they were fixing it so hopefully that will change. We will definitely stay here next time we come in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly in down town”
Reviews.Author: gregspeck
Reviews.Content: A few blocks from Grand Central, and close to dining and entertainment, this was a good choice for our two night NYc getaway. Very friendly staff, free wifi, inexpensive breakfast available across from Hotel on Lexington Ave. Rooms were clean, attractive, free in rom coffee and frig. Some noise from Lexington Ave

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay in Manhattan If You Like Fine Art”
Reviews.Author: valentin777
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to see sculptures, paintings, fine digital printed graphics and art! Also I found in my room a small collection of books in all popular world languages! I was in Manhattan for an interview for a job with The New York Times. The agency, is just one block away from RogerSmithHotel! If hired, I will recommend to NYTimes, all their future applicants to stay in your hotel! Best regards to Sophie, Kucuk and Randy, they are so gentle! Valentin

Reviews.Title: “Roger Smith Hotel was the best choice for our group.”
Reviews.Author: JIN345
Reviews.Content: We were eight women from various locations meeting in NYC to reconnect. Big pluses for us were the location, the caring front desk staff, maid service and especially the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel with cool atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: OandP
Reviews.Content: We had one week stay at this charming hotel in the middle of everything. With two teenagers it was perfect with a huge deluxe suite. Very welcoming and friendly staff. A perfect place if you want to walk, shop and explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel in a great location and a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Kokomis67
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Roger Smith almost 20 times in the last ten years almost always for multiple night stays. I don't think I've ever had the same room twice and have had rooms that range from standard to junior suite. It is always a little thrill to see what room I'll have and what its special features will be - an especially comfortable chair for reading or watching TV, lovely wall paper and complimentary furnishings and linens on the bed, a great desk for getting some work done. I always appreciate having the iron in the closet, the mini fridge under the TV, windows that open, drapes that block out light and a big soft and comfortable bed with great pillows. The toiletries in the bathroom are good ones and several times the toothbrush has been there right when I needed it. One of the best features of the whole experience is the warm and friendly hotel staff and owners - they always have a friendly, warm greeting which makes it feel a bit like coming home upon arrival whether the first day of my stay or when I return in the evening or during the day. We regularly have work related events at the Roger Smith and all the different staff who attend to the details make things run smoothly are great. The food too has been varied, flavorful, delicious and nicely presented from snacks, to breakfast, lunch and dinner. On several occasions I've left my luggage after checking out and before leaving New York to go home - they are very accomodating and it makes the last day of a trip easy without needing to carry luggage all over. The only complaint I have would be that occasionally, but often enough to be noted, there are problems with the elevators. With recent renovations this has occured less often, but even on this last visit there was a period when only one elevator was working. To summarize: I love staying at the Roger Smith!! Thanks for making my stays in NYC so pleasant and giving me a home away from home in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Roger Smith the best!”
Reviews.Author: juicee68
Reviews.Content: hade a luvely week at Roger Smith, the took so goog care of us ! the bed wre so nice and the svit was the best!!, we will be back!!! big kiss lindgren & seth

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Roger Smith Hotel NYC”
Reviews.Author: POpsi613
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into this hotel...we were greeted very warmly by Jacque, and our housekeeper Maryse - from Haiti (lovely, lovely person) right up to the moment that we checking out......by the ever so helpful Sophie Diaz.......Our family will definitely be coming back again to stay at the Roger Smith Hotel. We had the deluxe suite, and oh! What a lovely experience, beds were so comfortable...anything extra that we required was no sooner asked for, and suddenly it appeared! we also had family over to visit us at the hotel, and they felt like they were back visiting us at our homes in the West End of Glasgow....how uncanny is that! All I can say Folks is that you won't be disappointed, and that you will be treated very well all round.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: OddjobSweden
Reviews.Content: Roger Smith Hotel was the perfect hub for us during our first trip to New York - close to shopping, attractions, museums, etc. The hotel was just so small and intimate as we wished, with a service that met our requirements. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: dedmundson222
Reviews.Content: The trip to NYC was great. We stayed in a Jr. Suite at the hotel, which allows the convenience of a small refrig & micro. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable. The front desk staff, absolutely great. Gave us great suggestions of restaurants in the area, places to go, things to see.... The housekeeper was excellent, she was always smiling, very friendly and helpful no matter what was asked of her. The decor was modern and changed almost daily. I would make the following suggestions: add additional shelves in the bathroom (I had to always take out what I needed to use and then pack it away again due to a lack of space to leave it out); trade in the old TVs for new ones and go for better reception and more channels; the restaurant and bar was a bit pricey. It was truly wonderful to spend a week at this location, where we were able to walk to pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, liked the art and clientele”
Reviews.Author: lisa579
Reviews.Content: Great location. Small boutique hotel, like one you find in Europe. Interestingly, they also have visual art on the outside of the building and a small, attractive lobby. We got a suite for $269, not fancy, but comfortable. I'm guessing a regular room would have felt cramped. Actually got a better deal on it close to the day of travel and rebooked it for cheaper the day before! Small, artsy lobby. Some interesting international guests (Finnish women diplomats). Attractive bar/restaurant off the lobby, too pricy for us, but others enjoyed it. Helpful front desk clerk. Convenient deli across the street. Close to subway. 20 minutes from LaGuardia. I would stay again if the price was right. Convenient to Sloan Kettering Medical Center, which is where we were headed.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in many hotels, but what made this one great was the hospitality of the staff, esp. Ms Sophy Diaz”
Reviews.Author: 1SatisfiedCust0mer
Reviews.Content: The roof terrace isn't too bad either, nice view down on the city life

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in great location!”
Reviews.Author: AshaDasha
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Roger Smith Hotel- itâ€™s in a great location near the UN and Rockefeller Center, and Grand Central is close by as well. The staff was incredibly nice and accommodating, including the bubbly young woman at the front desk who even let us have the book I was interested in from our room! Great experience, comfortable roomâ€¦ weâ€™ll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: mattpedigo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I picked this hotel because of its convenient location and also because it was the cheapest hotel on Manhattan that wasn't a dump. We were pleasantly surprised to find that it was a cute older building, was walking distance to everything we wanted, and we got it without shoveling out a huge price. The room was not incredibly spacious but what is in NYC? It had everything we needed, a great view, and was remarkably quiet. What really made this place special was the staff. From the moment we checked in to check out, we were greeted with a professional and friendly staff. On the way out of our room, my girlfriend saw a book that she wanted. I approached the front desk and asked if there were any possible way I could buy it off of them. She said, "My treat!" and gave us the book. Not a lot of hotels like that...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Ranz007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the Labor Day weekend (3 nights, 4 days). The hotel lobby is bright red with cool scuptures so very artsy. I was expecting a small tiny room but I was floored when I saw the size of the room. First it had the most comfortable 2 double beds (looked like king size to me), good lighting, flat screen tv, and a moderate size bathroom. The hotel is located in a very business neighbourhood, very very safe, and few blocks (4-5)away from Time Square. Right next to the hotel is a Starbucks and the best thing is that right across from the hotel is a REDSTONE PIZZA place, which has the most filling breakfast for just $2.99 (2 eggs, 2 toast, bacon, and potatos) all made right infront of you. This is where you should have your breakfast. The Grand Terminal is a block away. The hotel has 2 restaurants, I never ate there because they were pricey. The neighbourhood is dead during weekends but gets very busy during weekdays. The only thing that was a bit inconvenient was the ever disconnecting free WI-FI. Also for $80 the hotel has their own a private car to drive you to the airport. It was worth it and less stressful and very comfortable. I gave myself 1 hour to get to the airport from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: EdnaA
Reviews.Content: We got a Junior Suite from Priceline for $140 for 3 nights. We were surprised at the roominess. The door was sticking, but a guy came up within minutes and fixed it. The staff was very attentive. We were right across from the Waldorf and the entertainment was watching all the UN dignitaries and their entourage leaving. Only complaint was the TV was real old skool, not that we watched it much with all the real life drama outside the window.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service, though staff are friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kwaizy
Reviews.Content: First night they put me (Asthmatic) in a smoking room without asking me. They then charged my credit card for the room rather than the company one provided before arrival. They made efforts to correct both problems, but unfortunately the errors were too big for me to leave a favorable review. Rooms are old, but clean. When the mini bar kicks in all the lights dim. Felt like shared hot water (temperature fluctuations during shower) Only 1 of 2 lifts working for most of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “From the time you walk in the door.....”
Reviews.Author: brown1677
Reviews.Content: You are greeted by "old friends". The staff at the RSH was certainly one of the most delightful groups I've ever witnessed in a hotel. Upon entering the lobby, Rafael is there to greet you either curb side or to assist you with your luggage. Next, Sophie will check you in within 20 seconds and you are off to your well appointed room. I stayed in a queen size deluxe room that was very spacious with a fairly large bathroom for NYC standards. My room also faced Lexington Avenue which made for a nice traffic symphony and fresh air but once you close the windows; you are closed off from the urban streets and fall into room's stillness. What a wonderful staff: Raf, Sophie, Bag, Randy and many others make this hotel tops on my list to stay again in the fall!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing staff you will find in The Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: BettieandJoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Roger Smith Hotel. It was my husband's first trip to The Big Apple, so naturally I was a little nervous about how he would acclimate to the fast pace of New York after flying in from our small town in Texas. Once we walked in to the lobby of The Roger Smith Hotel I knew that I had absolutely nothing to worry about. Every single one of the employees welcomed us with the warmest greetings. It was like being in a second home. The front desk was helpful with our tourist questions. The wait staff in Lily's was so incredibly kind, especially our server Omar. And, our room was gorgeous and spacious. When we find ourselves in New York CIty again there is no question we will be staying in our beloved Roger Smith Hotel. We highly recommend the locationl to all friendly folks from The Lone Star State and any other place for that matter. Sincerely, Bettie and Joe Texas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GranmaLondon
Reviews.Content: I went to New Your last August with my family and stayed at the Roger Smith hotel. The location of this property is excellent, 7 minutes walking from 5th Avenue. The rooms are big and very confortable! We had a great stay and the staff really made us feel welcome!! I would definetly recommed it to everybody!!

Reviews.Title: “Character in the big apple”
Reviews.Author: ASM36
Reviews.Content: In NY Its hard to find a hotel with character, clean and not overpriced. This is just that. Load and loads of character. Very nice place. The only down side is the restaurant next door that offers breakfast and room service. In fact not related to the hotel, but they do provide the service. They were nice, but the food was overpriced and multiple things were not ok with it (rotten fruit in the fruit salad etc). The hotel, however, is a gem. All the rooms are decorated with antiques and have a different look. Really lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well-located hotel, but stay was marred by mess-ups in our reservation.”
Reviews.Author: sbenglin
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith is well-located and has some of the largest, best-appointed rooms in the city. The roofdeck is wonderful and the food and service at Lily's are terrific. Our stay was far less than perfect, though, because the hotel messed up our reservations. We had reserved and paid for the largest suite for our group of 5 back in April - nearly 6 months in advance of our stay. We arrived and were told our room was not going to be available, and they planned to cram 4 adults and one child into a one-bed room. Uh, no. They tried to make it right and in the end it was fine, but we had to battle much more than we ought to have for appropriate rooms given that we had already paid in full for the Deluxe Suite. When we checked in many others were at the front desk complaining of messed up room reservations and rooms not available, so it may be a persistent problem. Next time we'll call ahead several times to ensure we have a place to lay our heads on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: glanpher
Reviews.Content: My GF and I recently stayed here for 3 nights in the heat of august. The location was perfect, close to central park, the UN, and the subway with quick access to SOHO and Brooklyn. There seemed to be a lot of european visitors which contributes a nice cosmopolitan feel. The room was great, I gather they are all uniquely decorated and have books left by previous visitors. There was also free wi-fi which is always nicer than getting some $12 charge on your bill. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night and had a very tasty meal of black cod and Filet. My only complaint was that some TV stations didn't come in very well so we watched a fuzzy Emmy's but we probably shouldn't have been watching TV in NY anyway.

Reviews.Title: “European style hotel at affordable rates!”
Reviews.Author: Outoftowners45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger Smith recently on our third trip to NYC and found this hotel to be the best! They had spacious rooms at an affordable rate compared to neighboring hotels. The free Wi-Fi was a plus as were the DVD free rental service. Its' location made sight-seeing very easy you could walk to most attractions. The room decor was home-like and similar to those one would stay in Europe. The staff was helpful and friendly and made you feel welcome. There was no business center but there are copy centers near-by and you can print off boarding passes at the front computer.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Roger Smith Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gumby011
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roger Smith Hotel many times for both business and pleasure and love it. My favorite room is #1111. Comfortable hotel with large rooms at a great location, Lexington and 47th. Each room is decorated different. Mac computers are located in the lobby for guests to use. The hotel is close to the subway, shops and restaurants. I highly recommend the Roger Smith Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel with style, comfort, great service, and value."”
Reviews.Author: nburling74
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith is a great find, with classic decor spiced up by original sculpture and artwork, friendly and attentive staff, and a charming little restaurant with great food. They also have a great roof-top hang-out. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Your room in the city”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelml
Reviews.Content: If you like to stay very central in the big city, have much space in your room, large fridge and non-standard-boring-room-design, at an affordable price,the Roger Smith Hotel is the one for you! Sure its not the most modern stylish hotel with all glass exterior and white walls, stainless steel and a 12 feet high ceiling. The hotel and more specific your own room feels comfortable like your own home. The Roger Smith hotel is perfect for you and/or your family who prefer to experience the city rather than bragging about which designerhotel you've stayed on. At there affordable prices and overall decent services no other hotel in the city can compete with the Roger Smith!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was supported with excellent service and experiences throughout the stay.”
Reviews.Author: SweetieBerry
Reviews.Content: Traveling in New York with clients with a Southern cultural experience means that each step of their experience in the "big city" had to be attended to carefully. The Roger Smith Hotel created an atmosphere of hospitality for my client's stay that will have us booking with the Roger Smith Hotel time and time again. We know every experience from meals to events will be handled with attention to detail and excellence. Well done Roger Smith Hotel and staff, well done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kaushikg2000
Reviews.Content: Located near to all the attaractions (only of I could get time), very friendly staff, makes you feel at home. Good service, convenient location and a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds - home like feel with hotel quality services”
Reviews.Author: Northeast_Traveler48
Reviews.Content: Very cosy and quite rooms, nice modern LCD , and the kitchenette in the suite was a great added value.

Reviews.Title: “I Always recommend the Roger Smith Hotel”
Reviews.Author: limoman1078
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the ROG for the last year. I am there at least twice a month for a number of days. The staff makes me feel very welcomed. I am always met when I arrive with a welcome home. The location is very good for my business.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it; good value !”
Reviews.Author: Ingka1971
Reviews.Content: We use the Roger Smith as one of our business hotels, though it's very convenient for your weekend break to NYC as well. It's location on Lexington av. is great. Walking distance from all major shopping destinations and NYC attractions. Close to the subway and plenty of taxi's. The outside of the hotel doesn't give anything away, it looks a bit shabby. The have somekind of a trendy thing going in one of the shopwindows, but I didn't got the point of it really .. but whatever ... The staff is efficient and very friendly and very helpfull (which is for NY standards quit a rare thing).. Vallet parking is available for 35usd per night, which I think it's reasonable for NYC. Town Car service to JFK airport 65 usd incl. tip and tax, which is not bad either ... especially if the town car becomes a stretched limo :-))) Free internet on the room, wireless .. somewhat slow but OK For NY standards the room are spacious and comfy. The Jacuzzi in the room was sweeeeeet especially if you have been walking around Manhattan the whole day. The streetside rooms are not very silent ..... but hej ... your in NY not on the freaking country side. The bed was not extremely soft, but I have had a good night rest on it. No sounds of the neighbours doing their thing for a change. Just book the place if you get a good deal ... it's good value, no worries. Say hi to the folks at the front desk from me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but has seen better days...”
Reviews.Author: Iain73
Reviews.Content: It's fair to say The Roger Smith hotel has seen better days. The place could probably do a refurb if I'm honest, although it's clean and friendly which is the main thing. Before you rule out this hotel I'd say the positives still make this place a very solid option - albeit not a particularly luxurious one Firstly the location is fantastic! It's right in the heart of the action, just four blocks north of Grand Central Station on Lexington Avenue. If you're flying into Newark catch the airport express coach just outside the terminal building for $15, it stops just outside Grand Central Station, a 5 minute walk, not too taxing even with suitcases. We got stuck in traffic for an hour on the way to NYC so be careful if you choose a taxi because the meter doesn't stop just because you do, could prove very expensive. The rooftop bar is great during the week (not open at weekends for some reason) a good place for a chilled out drink to start the night off. All hotel staff were friendly and helpful, but beware! The front desk were erratic with info and sent us off in the wrong direction on more than one occasion. They also told us they had no contacts to get us Yankees tickets, I thought that was very strange. We were able to book them through Ticketmaster using the free Internet in reception. One thing we noticed was the corner rooms are much bigger than all the other rooms, so request one of those if you want a more spacious room. They are big, especially as I'd heard all NYC rooms are tiny. I would stay here again if I could get a decent room rate. A couple of our NYC favourites... The Meatball Shop - You can't book and it's fairly chaotic, if you go at a random time the wait isn't too long. The meatballs are amazing, cheap and filling. Hard to find but just around the corner from Katz Deli Brass Monkey - If you're in The Meatpacking District, drop into this lively pub for some of the best chilli nachos ever! Three of us couldn't finish one plate. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “No AC, Peeling Molding Walpaper, Poor Service, and the Worst Stay EVER!”
Reviews.Author: drew7184
Reviews.Content: The Wall unit AC was off when I arrived and the room was over 90degrees. The room never cooled below 80 and the front desk would not even send anyone to look at it. The AC unit was covered in dust and taped into place. The wall paper was torn and in several places mold was growing,this was unbelievable. I can't believe I stayed here and will never stay here again. I think there should be a warning at the street that says "Stay here at your own Risk" for Health Reasons.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: goldengoat88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel from July 29- Aug 5,2010. Having 2 children, we loved the convinience. Close to everything like Rockefeller, 5TH AVE, Time Square, Central Park, ETC. Felt very safe... I recommend this hotel and I visit the city every other year.This is a great place for new visitors and they will surely find their way around easily. The hotel is close to all restaurants, major shopping centers, church, pharmacy, etc. I also want to thank the hotel staff for making our stay comfortable and safe. I now found the perfect place to stay when we go back to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: edchen1
Reviews.Content: stayed one night at the roger smith hotel. everything was perfect. nice ambiance and breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but tired and out-dated hotel that needs lots of TLC”
Reviews.Author: JIBJAB72
Reviews.Content: stayed here for just one night on a business trip to NYK. Location is great and very central, but the hotel in general and the room i stayed in (junior suite) was really old, outdated and tired. bed was comfortable enough, but bathroom was from the 70's and all other furniture in the room/hotel was old and tatty. Decor in my room was peeling, scratched, badly finished in many different places. Aircon in my room, but machine was noisy and positioned behind long curtains which shielded the majority of the benefit from the room when the curtains were closed at night. Seems like they have tried to create an eclectic hotel, but in reality its just a mix-match of furniture and fittings. Front desk staff were OK, but not amazing. Didn't eat at the hotel at all - the condition of my room didnt inspire me with enough confidence to eat at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: BillA59
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night on business. Great location - walking distance from UN and much of midtown. I checked-in early and got a room on the 3rd floor overlooking Lexington. Room was spacious, clean and well furnished including fridge and microwave. It was clean and the bed was comfy. Only complaint was the noise. Could hear the traffic just outside my window as well the subway below. Decided that I could live with it for one night and put my ear plugs in. I would stay again but only on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, though good location”
Reviews.Author: am_a_freethinker
Reviews.Content: We booked our short stay in NYC (2nights) thru Priceline. So, we didn't know what 3-star hotel we'd get. We found the Roger Smith Hotel to have a very disappointing room. It appeared to be run-down: - Peeling paint in the bathroom - Bathroom door would not stay closed - Loud, old, and barely-functioning AC - Broken mirror frame - Torn wallpaper I wish that they would have spent their artistic efforts on maintenance of the rooms, rather than the odd performance installation next-door.

Reviews.Title: “Suites at the Roger Smith Hotel are Roomy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Irishgrl_7
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed in a two bedroom suite. The suite was roomy- with a king sized bed, a twin bed and a pull out couch in a large living area. It also had a desk, a dining table and a small kitchenette. With three closets- one of them as large as the kitchenette- we had more than enough space for all of us to spread out. The only downfall- the steam from the bathroom would set off the smoke alarm. Wifi was included in our room rate. Hotel is 5-6 blocks from the subway. I did not take photos but I did take video. You can see it here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5jF5d0tEEwY

Reviews.Title: “Great value...Recommend, but...”
Reviews.Author: steelelegal
Reviews.Content: Nice older hotel. Many charming aspects which contributed to the character of the property. Nice convenient location in east midtown to most points of interest and tourist attractions. Attentive service. AC was turned as low as it would go, which kept the room relatively cool, but never cold (which I prefer when I sleep at night). No accessible ice machine on property, but front desk was good about delivering ice upon request. No (on site) room service but the hotel staff will accept and deliver to your room delivery from offsite (for a convenience charge). TVs were outdated with no PPV. Overall...nice property, friendly staff and good value. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: ingerHalmstad_Sweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger Smith Hotel in New York for four nights in June and we think it is a great hotel with walking dinstance to a lot of sights. The service was excellent and the food great. Especially enjoyed the spot on 16th floor and the lobster, Yummy! We can really recommend this hotel and we will definately try to get a room here the next time we come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: barristerbrent
Reviews.Content: What a treat to find a charming hotel within walking distance of Grand Central and the theaters. As a solo female traveler who goes to NYC on business, I felt pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reeds7
Reviews.Content: It amazes me how much hotels cost in New York and their value doesn't reflect the price. My experience at this hotel would have been better served at a Motel 6. For $239.00 at night, the room was extremely small, with no shelf space in the bathroom to put anything. The service was ok, but, again, this ancient hotel does not deserve $239.00 a night. The decor is substandard and location is so-so. And to think, this was one of the cheapest hotels I could find! Renuvate!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - failed to meet expectations , would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: IndiaGF
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the Roger Smith hotel my immediate thoughts were not great. The carpet was dirty and the reception area appealed dull and lacking in any kind of sophistication. However, i assumed i was being over critical and proceeded to our room. We had booked a One bedroom suite with a kitchenette for 2 weeks, so expected the room to be fresh, tidy and comfortable for the price we were going to be paying. The suite was the opposite. It smelt stale, The sofa bed was sagging, had stains and cigarette burns and the foam stuffing was visible through the ripped cover. To make matters worse, the carpet in the bedroom was stained, and the wallpaper was peeling off . The coffee table had footprints on, and the kitchenette was dirty, and the size of a small wardrobe. Immediately we complained to the staff at reception asking to move rooms and the manager moved us too a double room for the night. This room was slightly better. However, it was filthy. About a inch of dust clogged the picture rail, the sofa was ripped and the pillows were dirty. Not to mention the shower was leaking, the bath was tiny(about as big as two sinks )and the air conditioning was so loud it drowned the other noises. We came to the conclusion after speaking with people on the phone that the hotel was not worth the 3,000 + dollars and we should move hotels. which we did. Roger smith is a very over priced, unclean and unsatisfying hotel. which did not meet expectations, and looked completely different to the photos on this website, and their webpages. Although it is a well located hotel, and with attention to detail to detail and a better welcome and a proper 4 star service it could be a good hotel. i have photos of the rooms we experienced if wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, needs to address some issues before I would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: BusyMom0254
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 20 month old son, and I stayed at the Roger Smith Hotel this weekend in Room 509. The style of our room was "vintage" as my husband called it, and I thought the size of the "standard" room was pretty large. The room was clean and there was a nice spread of complimentary magazines, a collection of books, toiletries, and coffee available. Overall, our trip to New York was fantastic. We checked in late on Friday night, and the front desk employee was friendly and helpful. He recommended a nearby 24-hour pharmacy and delivered a pop-up crib and extra bed linens to our room within the first 5 minutes of our arrival. Each day, we asked the staff for directions and recommendations, and we were always pleased with the service. Now, on to the room -- Immediately upon entering the room, the first thing I noticed was the heat. The room looked nice and clean, probably exactly like in the picture featured on Trip Advisor, but there was no air flowing. So I found the thermostat and clicked it to "on". When it turned on, it was extremely LOUD. I worried about how that would affect our sleep, and I asked the employee if it was going to get any better or if not, if we could change rooms. He explained that it was an older unit, and that the hotel was in the process of changing them out, but it was taking time, and with the hotel fully booked we could not change on that particular night. ***However, I remembered reading a review on Trip Advisor that was several years old complaining of the same exact thing. I seriously, seriously doubt they are "in the process" of addressing this issue. If they are seriously working on this, then call ahead and ask if the work has been completed before you go.*** Anyway, the noisy A/C proved to not be too big of a problem. The noise actually was like "white noise" for us because there was a street market on Sunday which played loud music right outside the hotel and the A/C helped to drown it out. But the room never really cooled down. My son, who is hot-natured, woke up several times because he was too warm. Like I said, the hotel was nice and clean, but I still had one other complaint which was significant to me. The bed. I think the only way they can fix this is to replace the mattresses. The bed had a major sinkhole right in the middle. I woke up every morning with a back ache. I was going to flip the mattress myself, but it is not the kind that you can just flip over because of the style. I think it's done its job, but now it is time to go! Please replace the mattresses ASAP. ***I would also recommend asking if this problem has been addressed before committing to booking here.*** Additional comments: Great location, really great. Friendly staff. I would probably recommend this hotel to friends, but not in it's current condition. They need to make some improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Patrick10052
Reviews.Content: Very Comfortable Hotel to re-charge after exploring New York. 5 minute walk to Grand Central Station to take you anywhere in all of New York. 3 minute walk from Park Avenue. The staff take very good care to help you enjoy NY. When you are exploring NY, they carefully re-new your room and made our stay perfect. The close proximity to reasonable restaurants lounges made this hotel location affordable. 16th Floor Henry's Roof-Top Lounge with music is an added plus to escape from the Kids. At night, rooms were quite so sleeping was not disturbed. This is not a glitsy Hotel, but you use a hotel to sleep. This is a nice hotel I will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Old world syle with a modern twist”
Reviews.Author: appfernotter
Reviews.Content: We were giddy with delight upon entering our suite at the Roger Smith Hotel. Warm and welcoming decor, clean, comfortable accomodations made us feel at home in an otherwise artsy hotel located in a glamorous New York neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of elegance with a European flair.”
Reviews.Author: judesfan
Reviews.Content: Comfort, convenience and warm hospitality on the fashionable upper east side of Manhattan. . . What more could one ask? We enjoyed a perfect stay at the Roger Smith Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jonnah05
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith is a boutique hotel located on Lexington between 47th and 48th...Each room had a unique theme that allows for the feeling of home eventhough it may be a business trip. Every member of the hotel's front desk appears to me multi-lingual and extremely courteous and professiona...Guests are made to feel very welcome and, if you need assistance wtih theaters, dinner or even playground locations, the staff is very accommodating...This hotel has the best front desk and management staff I've encountered on my numerous travel adventures.. If convenience is what you're looking for, you've found it. From the 24-hour Duane Reid pharmaceutical and convenience store located across the street to restaurants, floral and pastry shops at every economical level can be found in nearby walking distance. You can walk to tour the United Nations building. Roger Smith is in the historical Turtle Bay neighborhood where you will find former homes of such stars as Katherine Hepburn, Paul and Joann Newman, just to name a few illuminaries... I would rate them five-stars plus...

Reviews.Title: “Quirky mid town hotel fills the bill!”
Reviews.Author: HarryEncinitas_CA
Reviews.Content: A tad on the aging side but ideally located so that you can enjoy an appetizer of oysters at Grand Central Station before dinner and then a delightful luncheon of Ã‡herrystones and Solf Shell Ã‡rabs. I was upgrade to a large two room suite - great breeze with all windows open! As a New Yorker I didn't mind the traffic noise altho' they could have turned off the flute music at the art exhibit at night - kinda got to me at 5:30 AM ... but not entirely bothersome! Pleasant staff - easy printing return flights boarding passes right at the lobby! Generally a good and delightful experience .. and while I usually stay at the Meridien, I found the Roger Smith a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Got 1st class service”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelerBuddy
Reviews.Content: I truly loved the artistic side of the hotel, its conveniently located near Gd Central and all the big shopping avenues and its a great bargain for such a location. I was upgraded to the suite so I had a perk! I would recommend with no hesitation! Try also their bar by the lobby, they have a nice b/fast

Reviews.Title: “the front desk service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: NYvisitor294217
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know why people are raving about the customer service here. I loved the room, the location was convenient, and the breakfast was good. Everything was okay until the last moment and left me feeling angry and bitter. This hotel needs to train their front desk staff. Their customer service was nonexistent. I had left my luggage at the front desk for a few hours and when I got back to the hotel to pick up my bags, a young gentleman told me that the bellman wasnâ€™t here and that he cannot go check himself and leave the front desk because he is/will be alone. Fine. 15 minutes of waiting and still no sign of the bellman, another front desk staff shows up. The younger gentleman tells him that I was waiting for our luggage and his response was â€œAm I the bellman?â€�. He wasnâ€™t willing to help me or even seem to care the least bit that I was waiting there for so long. We ended up waiting for 25 minutes just for the bellman to show up and get our bags. This is unacceptable. Where was the bellman all this time and why couldnâ€™t anyone else help me? They need to hire someone more helpful at the front desk. If it werenâ€™t for the cab driver that drove as fast as he could to the airport, I wouldâ€™ve probably missed my flight. Iâ€™ve stayed here twice and was thinking about making it my go-to place when Iâ€™m in New York, but Iâ€™ll go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: mike6619
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago I needed a place to stay overnight for a two day convention. After a bit of grousing about the price I checked out several other "budget" places that I've used in the past and learned The Roger Smith Hotel at Lexington and 47th St was comparable and in some instances considerably less than the competition. It was the perfect spot for me for its location (just a few blocks from subway and bus lines in all directions) and my room was clean as a whistle. It was decorated simply but adequately, the bed was comfortable, the elevators were fast and efficient, and there are many places around for casual dining. I'll not hesitate to book there for a week in July when I'll be mixing business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: NikoFinland
Reviews.Content: I spent several nights in Roger Smith and it was really a pleasant change in contrast to these big corporate hotel chains I usually go. Roger Smith has small but cozy lobby and practical sized bar. The first thing I paid attention was the friendly welcome and service at the reception - the same continued during the whole stay. Rooms were not fancy. They might need a bit of updating, especially cooling machines and the bathroom, but nevertheless everything was OK and I didn't mind even if everything was not made in this decade. Though we did have annoying problem of the heating machine, that worked too well and we were sweating like bigs at nigh. Well, I should have ask to fix it but I didn't, so it's my own fault. Pricing of the hotel was reasonable in contrast to other hotels, not the cheapest but reasonable. Location was quite alright, nearest subway station was couple blocks north, but we did manage very well by foot. There is a very good deli just across the Lexington ave. where you can have your breakfast, lunch or evening snack. There is also a grocery store/pharmacy in the next block, so you can find anything you need within 100 meters form the hotel. The most important thing that I can remember was the exquisit customer service and friendliness. The customer was really the king in Roger Smith, and this is something you don't find too much anymore so I can really appreciate it. When I stayed there I really felt like I was wanted customer. I can warmly recommend the exprerience of Roger Smith to anyone who likes to feel how customer service should be! P.S. Another reason why I would go again to Roger Smith is that they have a free wifi connection in rooms. Usually in the states this is for a fee and for me this really made a difference! They also had two Macs at the lobby for internet browsing.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you need to stay close to other locations.”
Reviews.Author: mandrean
Reviews.Content: All things considered, the value is there and the price is inline with that area of NYC. The single queen-sized bed was kind of a small room. The window over looked Lexington Ave so there was a lot of noise coming from down there but what can you do, it's NYC. The bar downstairs is kinda small. The location is near a lot of other hotels, restaurants, coffee shops, etc. Customer service is pretty good too. Also, I had trouble connecting to the free wifi, which kinda bummed me out because I actually had some downtime to upload some videos and blog and couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rkpreston
Reviews.Content: I stayed with the hotel which was paid for by a consulate. I think the rooms that end in a 10 are the best value. The windows open all the way but Lexington Avenue is very busy. I had a view of the top of the Waldorf Astoria Hotel and the GE Building. Close walk to 42nd Street, Grand Central and the UN. Small and friendly. Unfortunately, the alarm was set by a previous guest and it went off in the middle of the night. Slightly worn furnishings but a classic old-style hotel common in the Grand Central area. Free wifi in the room, mini fridge, safe and ironing board and iron in room. I was in room 1210. It goes up to the 16th floor. No room as any sweeping vistas in that this part of midtown is full of 50+ story skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CoupleStockholm
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay during four days in this hotel. The personal was very helpful with everything we needed. The best service we ever had. The breakfast was howewer not our heathy stile. Our room in 4Â´th floor was a little bit noicy. Overall highly recommended. Mr and Mrs Wickgren Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Gaskyns
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel two nights before leaving for a weekend in New York. What a find! It is a small hotel with 130 rooms and a wonderful individual feel. We had a fantastic corner room with two double beds and it felt as if we were in our own bedroom at home! The decor is individualised for each room - there is none of that 'corporate' feel produced by furniture that is so obviously made for every hotel in every city anywhere in the world. The room was spotlessly clean and stocked with good amenities. The staff were helpful and very friendly. The restaurant is great for breakfast. We just can't recommend this hotel highly enough and will definitely be staying there again when we visit our son in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: HSutherland
Reviews.Content: Heater in main bedroom made loud a loud banging noise off and on all night. Suite was huge and spacious! Outdated decor. Great to have a dining table and mini kitchen to save money for breakfasts when eating out a lot. Walking distance to subway and to sights - time square etc...paid $300.00 per night

Reviews.Title: “Familyfriendly, cosy, clean and big rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Solen1
Reviews.Content: Familyfriendly, cosy, clean and big rooms. When we arrived to the hotel had the staff upgraded our room from a junior suite to a deluxe suite for the same price as junior suite.The staff is wounderful. We are coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sailor6700
Reviews.Content: Room on 9th floor had much street noise through poorly installed Window AC unit. Difficult to get to sleep with sirens, horns all night. They moved me to 15 floor which as better, but for the price of $285 I could have stayed at a much better hotel. Desk help was courteous and professional, bed comfortable, restaurant was pricy but okay. Health club fee was $35/day for a place across the street, which was way too excessive. Room was clean, furniture, decor dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from Kucuk, Sofia, and Daisy”
Reviews.Author: Crusader68
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the Roger Smith, and just as pleasant as my first one in January. Daisy was terrific with my reservation, Kucuk (Go Galatasaray!) and Sofia very helpful with finding me just the right room each time. Please don't tell anyone about the Roger Smith - I want it all to myself.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of my favorite hotels in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roger Smith from Monday to Friday of last week while in NYC on business. I love the hotel, even with some of its quirks. I cannot say enough about the room sizes... the room we were in, 1202, had to have been about 750 sqft, which is bigger than most NYC apartments. The decor just needs to be refreshed a little and I think it's coming time to replace the beds, but still, the size of the rooms, all the windows, etc make it one of my favorite places in NYC, I truly feel like I have a home while there. I moved to a Times Square hotel for Fri-Mon and although it was one-star higher, and a lot more expensive, the rooms were tiny, the bathrooms offered no privacy, and the windows looked into a light well. I really wish I had stayed at the Roger Smith and was seriously contemplating going back. When you get to your room at the Roger Smith, you'll understand that size truly does matter - and you'll be hard-pressed to find rooms this large and roomy at any NYC hotel... which makes it soooo much more enjoyable when traveling, especially if you're not traveling solo.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: mwdelmo
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about our experience at the Roger Smith hotel. I chose it solely by the reviews on trip advisor because I wanted a hotel close to Grand Central Station. I was expecting it to be clean and updated with small rooms. Not only was it updated and spotless, but the room we had was huge by New York standards. We were 2 adults and 2 young teens and we had plenty of room. The bedding was plush and the bathroom was very clean. We arrived in NY at 10:45AM and our room was actually ready so we could check in early. I would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, wonderful space”
Reviews.Author: niccoft
Reviews.Content: I booked through a promotion on the hotel website, which made it quite inexpensive. Even at twice the price it is a bargain. My room had a full living room, with sofas and armchairs around a coffee table and fireplace, a dining area, a kitchen, a separate bedroom. Water pressure seemed a little weak, but not a real problem. Fantastic value, fantastic space. The decor is charming, with full bookshelves, (not necessarily what i would chose to read, but they make it seem like at home), careful selection of photos and art. Thank you for a wonderful stay,

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: matkov
Reviews.Content: By reading good reviews I thought this will be a nice hotel but i was wrong. Rooms could be cleaned better, carpet was really dirty and it was so loud during night that is impossible to sleep. I was suprised that one day housekeeping did not even come to do the room. I have asked front desk for late check out (instead 1pm to have 2 pm) and answer was it is possible but you have to pay full room price. Just for one hour extra. Housekeeping woke me up early in the morning and kept coming every hour to see if room is vacant. Very disapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Biztraveler72
Reviews.Content: I understand hotels in Manhattan are pricy and this is an alternative. However as a business traveler I have never stayed anywhere like this where I was afraid of my feet touching the floor and some critter would come running out! Then when I wanted to turn the heat on it was a radiator not a temp. control heater. Very rough. The people were very friendly. I am just disappointed. You could see the dirt on the carpet it looks like the same carpet from 1920!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location - minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Bills2
Reviews.Content: We chose Roger Smith for its location and price, and the reviews made it sound like the owner and staff were trying to provide good service. We weren't disappointed, in general. The room was clean, plenty large enough and warm. Although the plumbing was a little quaint, it worked and we had no complaints. The free Wi-Fi worked well, and the bar at Lily's was a welcome find. Two minor complaints: The noise from Lexington Ave woke me repeatedly during the night. Even though we were on the 13th floor (don't most buildings skip the 13th floor?) it sounded like the cars and sidewalk noises were right outside the window. Also, in the morning we went out for breakfast, and upon return the door key-cards didn't work. The hall maid kindly let us back in, and when I asked the desk about it later they explained that because we were due to check out that day, the cards are disabled at 10am. Now, checkout was 12 noon, so why they would lock us out of the room at 10 is beyond me. Nevertheless, we will certainly choose Roger Smith again when staying over in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel, great value, with one caution”
Reviews.Author: deekaye
Reviews.Content: This visit to NY I tried the Roger Smith Hotel and was very pleased with all things internal to the hotel, not to mention extraordinary low rates. There was a wondefully large and clean room with a desk and easy chairs, a spacious bathroom with shelves, thick walls ensuring privacy and quiet, a coffeemaker and fridge, free wifi, a public computer and printer, a very nice little restaurant, uniformly helpful staff, nice touches from the hotel's arts program, a comfortable bed, a workable TV and alarm clock, and an acceptable heating system. (There was no robe, room service, electronic gadgets, or haute decor, but these things should not be expected in this kind of hotel.) The one warning is that nearly every room faces Lexington Avenue, so one weekend night there were sirens and horns all night. Bring good earplugs and turn the heater/AC to "fan" to drown the din. The only other, minor caveat is not to expect well-lit, magnified, or full-length mirrors for grooming.

Reviews.Title: “Great rest!”
Reviews.Author: algebraman
Reviews.Content: I have never slept better in my life! What more can one say?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service!”
Reviews.Author: davefleet
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, the customer service at the Rogers Smith Hotel was fantastic. Friendly and helpful, the staff went above and beyond for us. The flip side, I suppose, is that in order for that to happen there had to be problems to solve: - Our initial room had an extremely loud heater which literally kept us up all night on our first night (we were then transferred to a suite, which was fabulous). - We never did receive the bacon truffles (I kid not) which our package promised and which we were very curious about. However, we did receive a bottle of wine and a mount of chocolate truffles as an apology. With that said, our jaws dropped at the friendliness and general service levels. Highly responsive and very welcoming. That alone has made the Roger Smith Hotel the place I'll stay at whenever I'm in New York for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service, good location”
Reviews.Author: hustlelancaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on December 18th for 1 night before embarking on a cruise. Check in was fine, struggled to get the room key to work so a nice lady appeared and opened the door for us. She decided the room was too small for my family (wife, 8 year old and I ) so she put us in a suite at no extra cost. Location was good, we stayed on Times square on our return from the cruise and it was far too busy, this was good for Grand Central and Empire State. Hotel maybe a touch tired but for what you pay its pobably the best value we got from the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment living with hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: corriewrinkle
Reviews.Content: Our family booked four suites for the Christmas Holiday. The rooms were spacious and a welcome treat from the little 5x5 rooms that you get in the so called luxury hotels. The location is excellent. The staff were helpful. The rooms were clean and the hotel is in the process of being renovated. The upper floors were not noisy and you cannot hear anything in the bedroom because the rooms are so far back from the hallway. The bell staff were very helpful. You are welcome to waste your money elsewhere. As for our family, we love the hotel, and would return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: sightseerMcLeanVa
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 suites, both had a living room, one with a fireplace. The beds were very comfortable with nice sheets and comforters. The bathrooms were very clean with nice quality towels. The little kitchenettes were perfect for our needs. The location of the hotel made it easy for us to walk to many places we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: ignaciorv
Reviews.Content: It's the best hotel in New York for several reasons. The first and more important reason is the treatment that you receive from the whole hotel staff, the second more important reason is that you had the opportunity to have breakfast at the hotel without having to pay any additional charges for this breakfast service. And another major reason why I think this is the best hotel in New York is its location. It's located in a very centric part of new york but it isn't very busy so it is the perfect kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: edhandsome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rm 911. It's a two bedroom suite with fireplace in the living room. Another TV in the, dining room. Marble bathroom.-- It gives you the feeling of being home away from home. Located in the city which is very convenient to go shopping. The staffs are extremely courteous and friendly. Honest housekeeping - I noticed my bracelet was gone while window shopping. Not sure where I lost it. But when I got into our room, it was neatly placed in the nite table. :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_Newfoundland
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews I had read and a recommendation from a friend - we had expected an older, but clean and roomy hotel room. Indeed the rooms must all be different, and we were not given a very good suite. We occupied a one Bedroom suite for 4 nights. The living room was quite large; the bedroom not bad, but the bathroom was very small, no counter space on the sink at all for even a toothbrush, let alone makeup or hair brush...we had to lay the hair straightener on the toilet seat and hair brush in the sink while doing our hair. The tub had paint stains or marks of some sort, the cloth shower curtain was not very clean. The three rooms were just not clean and they were run down. The telephone in our room smelled of sweat..fortunately I had disinfectant wipes which I had to use on both phones, they were quite dirty. The phone in the bedroom didn't work. The wallpaper in the master bedroom was torn up in places; there were huge pieces of broken glass behind one of the heaters in our room; and huge stains on the carpet in the bedroom. The bedroom easy chair was very dirty looking and worn. The kingsize bed was extremely comfortable...so slept well. The heat could not be controlled in our room despite asking twice to have it turned off somehow....we kept our air conditioner on at all times and there was no vent in the bathroom which was like a furnace most of the time, especially when having showers. The small bathroom was directly off the side of our bed; so my daughter and niece had to come into our room to use the tiny washroom. We had to call twice to get the two bathrobes that were supposed to be included with our suite. The walls in the pantry kitchen were dirty as were the corners of the floor. The location was excellent, but we were disappointed in the room. It felt dirty. We paid close to $1,500 US for four nights....so although we enjoyed the extra space and some of the unique features in the room - we were not really comfortable with the quality and cleanliness and felt as though we had been put into a run down room. We did not have a lot of interaction with staff, however everyone appeared friendly and courteous. This was our first time in NYC and we loved it. It will not be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Big clean room, reasonable price and the most comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Meudonnais
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 8-year-old while visiting family. The room was much larger and cheaper than other NYC hotels in which we have stayed. It's old in an elegant way. There is room to move around, and everything is in its place. My son kept talking about the soft bed for the rest of our trip. He didn't want to leave, and he complained when we had to switch hotels later in the week. The next hotel was much smaller and more expensive. The Roger Smith was clean, and the sheets and towels were new. We'll book ahead next time to stay here. It's close to Grand Central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, restaurant and elegant room!”
Reviews.Author: Noodlenose
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s more than location, location, location (mid-town, east-side New York). The Roger Smith also has a reliable, warm-hearted, responsive, professional staff. We tested its sports bar and were pleased by the appetizers (including smoked fish) and entrÃ©e (wild mushroom risotto) and dessert (apple tart Ã¡ la mode and brownies Ã¡ la mode, perfect for splitting and sharing). We also tested its restaurant at breakfast and were pleased with the extra touches of raisins and brown sugar to accompany our oatmeal. We needed to stay in a room with equipment for a disabled person and were impressed with the junior suiteâ€™s elegance and perfection. This included a sofa with easy chairs and two flat screen TVs, one a big one in the living area, with a handy mini-kitchen-in-a-French Provincial free standing closet with a refrigerator, microwave, white china and coffee and tea amenities. The plantsâ€”imagine thisâ€”are all alive and healthy and the books in the reading nook are well dusted and appealing. All you need to Wi-Fi is a password. The bedroom was comfortable, too, with its king sized bed and comforterâ€”also with a small flat screen TV. The bathroom was bigger than most New York bedrooms, with a glass-walled marble shower that could accommodate a roll-wheelchair. We had unfailingly courteous attention from the staff that even rounded up an extra wheelchair for us to use, Kucuk G. Bag, the front office manager has an outstanding crew. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Midtown Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rugbytraveler16
Reviews.Content: RS is a charming midtown hotel with unique accents that make each room unique. Rooms are clean, comfortable and surprisingly spacious. The staff was friendly and attentive without overwhelming. An excellent value. Breakfast was pricey, but there are good alternatives within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Roger Smith is homey and a great escape from the bustling city.”
Reviews.Author: keithburtis
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith hotel takes pride in itâ€™s service. From the point you check in to the moment you leave they always make you feel welcome. The room I stayed in was like no other Hotel room I had ever been in. As someone who really dislikes the city, escaping to my room was a real treat. The room had a wonderful big comfy bed and a really homey feel more reticent of a Bed and Breakfast in Maine than a production hotel room at the local Holiday Inn. From what I understand all of the rooms are unique and no two are alike. So much for a branded standardized experience huh? I want to come back just to see what the next room will be like!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Ellen R
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at The Roger Smith Hotel in mid-town Manhattan this week, and it truly felt like it was home away from home, albeit with a better bar! I was traveling for business and found the location to be very convenient to all of the locations I had to visit. The welcome was warm, my room was large and very clean, and the food was wonderful, both in the full-service restaurant, Lily's, and at three catered events I attended within the hotel. I would describe The Roger Smith as a boutique hotel without an ounce of pretension. Each day when I arrived back at the hotel, I found the lobby staff welcoming and attentive, the bar and restaurant lively and pleasantly full, and my room always quiet and peaceful. Lily's is a favorite destination for dining, socializing and business meetings for local business people and residents too - a sure sign of excellence when the neighbors are patrons. This was my first stay at the Roger Smith, and I can guarantee it will not be my last. I had recommended the hotel before I even stayed there myself on the strength of the recommendations of friends, and my stay lived up to and exceeded all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel that had good service and large, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: pensfan58
Reviews.Content: I was the winning bidder on two nights at this hotel at a charity auction and knew that at some point, I'd be in need of staying over for buisness in NYC. With a dinner and holiday party back to back, this was a perfect spot to be in. Walked to work in the morning and back after the evening functions. Although the "sounds of NY" are about you, I had no trouble falling asleep in the comfy bed. The room was like a small apartment complete with a little kitchenette area. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast at Lilly's was also very good. I'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Roger Smith has HUGE rooms and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Kudzu5382
Reviews.Content: I love the size of the rooms, hence the title of my review, at The Roger Smith. It is centrally located - close to a subway station - and one of the classier places in town that is still reasonably priced. The hotel staff is always friendly and accomodating - especially Sophy at the front desk. I've heard her speak at least four different languages to guests! Stay here! I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The food is dreamy!”
Reviews.Author: Bleachyspice
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a short break in New York as a celebration of her 30th birthday. We stumbled upon the Roger Smith Hotel one evening and decided to have a drink in the bar.We felt really relaxed and comfortable and decided to eat in the restaurant. The food is amazing - we had the tenderloin and it was the best we have ever tasted - cooked to perfection. The restaurant manager - Jamiel - chatted to us - he is very charming! On learning why we were visiting the city he insisted on us having a complimentary desert and suggested the delicious creme brulee' made with sweet pumpkin. WELL, it was the dreamiest thing we have ever tasted! if you go there for food, you must have it. Although we weren't staying in the hotel, we felt we were treated in a special way. It was my 4th time in NY and I had never noticed the Hotel before but I know where I'll be going for dinner next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: vietor
Reviews.Content: Every now and again we each find a true gem in life. I was fortunate enough to have found one a few months ago in midtown Manhattan. Located in the most central and convienant of locations in the city is a small boutique hotel, The Roger Smith Hotel, staffed by the most amazing, caring and wonderful people in New York City. Not only have they embraced me, but now, my entire family (we have all stayed at various times and our visits are many, now) and the first few of many dear friends that I will personally recommend to this gem. I know I am not alone in my praise, for often in the elevator, or the lobby other guests have remarked at how wonderful the staff has made them feel. Each room and suite has a character of its own and while not all are absolutely perfect, any flaws are more than made up by the friendliness and competance of the excellent staff and the convenience of the location. If you want to feel part of a family, special and welcomed by the best New York has to offer you will hurry to make a reservation at this truly remarkable hotel. My many thanks: Kucuk, Randy, Mani, Sophy, Gemma, Rafael, Deforest, Vicenc, a wonderful house keeping staff and, please, forgive me, to those few I haven't mentioned by name, you are equally wonderful. Last, but not least, is the excellance of the food and service at the "in house" bar and restaurant Lily's. Again, my thanks to all the staff there, including, but not limited to Ramon, Mark and Yamile. Each and every stay has been a pleasure!! Thank you, from Williamsburg, VA!!

Reviews.Title: “Always Perfection...”
Reviews.Author: Numberonemusic
Reviews.Content: Ahhh.. there is no better place to stay. For a great location, comfort, coziness, good food.. etc. This is a boutique hotel with lots of personality. It is old and has it's little quirks, BUT it has spacious rooms, it's clean, the beds and pillows are super SUPER comfortable (so comfy I checked to see what matresses they were using) , very homey, has comfortable charm, lots of real books to peruse in each room, cool art and antiques. A caring staff... It's like having your very own apartment in NYC. A home away from home. I recommend this hotel 1000%

Reviews.Title: “You simply cannot beat the value and location.”
Reviews.Author: AquaAce
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic, the service was second to none, the location was perfect, I travel to NY often on business and usually stay at Hilton at double the price. You simply cannot beat the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, very friendly staff, good offer by direct call.”
Reviews.Author: BerlinMarie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful big rooms and very friendly staff make your stay comfortable. Needless to say that the location near Madison Avenue and Grand Central is fantastic. The prices offered were by a call directly from the Hotel Lobby to the Reservation Service were very good, the normal rate though is a bit expensive for an ordinary traveler... The atmosphere is very friendly and nice restaurants are around, at night it is quiet and you find a good and relaxing sleep. If you have a chance, just go there and try yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a fantastic staff”
Reviews.Content: The Roger Smith hotel has a great location, very nice accomodations, and best of all a great staff. The staff including Kucuk Bag, Rafeal, Manny, Randy, and Mark were excellent. They all made us feel right at home..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: GLI_2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger Smith for 4 nights during our 1 year anniversary. First off, the staff are fantastic and extremely helpful. The building is older and so are the rooms, but they were very comfortable and the cleaning staff cleaned our room every day. Honestly if you are going to New York for the first time and you are following a budget this is by far the best hotel in the city. Plus the LOCATION is unbelievable for the price you pay...5 mins max. to Grand Central Station, 15 mins max. to Times Square. Subway is on 51st street 4 blocks away. There are hundreds of coffee shops, eateries and anything you could think of around it. Another great asset is the fact that they offer free computers in the lobby so you can check e-mails and what not, also their tourist nook is great. Its in the lobby and has hundreds of maps and flyers for anyone not familiar with the city. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great service, great location, GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: YK-LA
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is wonderful - right in the middle of NYC - makes it convenient to go anywhere you'd like. Grand Central was walking distance, or even 2 bus stops down the street if you're too lazy to walk. The service and staff were exceptional! They were courteous, very prompt, and made much efforts to make sure our stay was nice. Definitely a GO-BACK! :)

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: normally go to this hotel when travelling on a budget is the less expensive hotel we can get with a superb location and a big clean room decor is very classic which i personally hate but thats me (old tv and bathroom,plenty of flowers at courtains etc) anyway when in NYC i really spend very little time in my room so a good bed and a clean bath and room is a must and this hotel performs its an old property very well mantained and located if you get a good price just go for it you cannot go wrong 2 apple computers at the lobby for free good and spanish speaker front desk clerks a lot of value here good 3 stars hotel
